original: original_corpus: 'Proteins in the eye lens have negligible turnover and therefore progressively accumulate chemical modifications during aging. Carbonyls and oxidative stresses, which are intricately linked to one another, predominantly drive such modifications. Oxidative stress leads to the loss of glutathione (GSH) and ascorbate degradation; this in turn leads to the formation of highly reactive dicarbonyl compounds that react with proteins to form advanced glycation end products (AGEs). The formation of AGEs leads to the crosslinking and aggregation of proteins contributing to lens aging and cataract formation. To inhibit AGE formation, we developed a disulfide compound linking GSH diester and mercaptoethylguanidine, and we named it carboxitin. Bovine lens organ cultured with carboxitin showed higher levels of GSH and mercaptoethylguanidine in the lens nucleus. Carboxitin inhibited erythrulose-mediated mouse lens protein crosslinking, AGE formation and the formation of 3-deoxythreosone, a major ascorbate-derived AGE precursor in the human lens. Carboxitin inhibited the glycation-mediated increase in stiffness in organ-cultured mouse lenses measured using compressive mechanical strain. Delivery of carboxitin into the lens increases GSH levels, traps dicarbonyl compounds and inhibits AGE formation. These properties of carboxitin could be exploited to develop a therapy against the formation of AGEs and the increase in stiffness that causes presbyopia in aging lenses.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "The proteins within the eye lens, which do not turn over, accumulate chemical changes over time due to aging. The primary drivers of these changes are carbonyls and oxidative stresses, closely connected processes. Oxidative stress results in the depletion of glutathione (GSH) and the breakdown of ascorbate, leading to the creation of reactive dicarbonyl compounds. These compounds interact with proteins, forming advanced glycation end products (AGEs), which cause the proteins to crosslink and aggregate, contributing to the aging of the lens and the development of cataracts. To counter the formation of AGEs, a disulfide-based compound combining GSH diester and mercaptoethylguanidine, dubbed carboxitin, was synthesized. When used in the organ culture of bovine lenses, carboxitin increased the levels of GSH and mercaptoethylguanidine in the lens nucleus. It was effective in preventing the crosslinking of mouse lens proteins, the creation of AGEs, and the formation of 3-deoxythreosone, a significant precursor to AGEs derived from ascorbate in the human lens, all mediated by erythrulose. Furthermore, carboxitin reduced the glycation-induced stiffening in mouse lenses, as measured by compressive mechanical strain in organ culture. By elevating GSH levels and capturing dicarbonyl compounds, carboxitin prevents the formation of AGEs. The characteristics of carboxitin present a potential therapeutic avenue to combat AGE formation and the resultant stiffness leading to presbyopia in aging lenses.", "named_entities": ["glutathione (GSH)", "ascorbate", "advanced glycation end products (AGEs)", "carboxitin", "dicarbonyl compounds", "erythrulose", "3-deoxythreosone", "presbyopia"]}

original: original_corpus: 'The Global Invasive Species Database, GISD, comprises 27 species of the most significant invasive alien insects in the world (through November, 2005), 6 of which are originally native to China, 11 are established in China, and 10 have a potential invasion threat to China. This paper discusses these species in terms of distribution, harmfulness and dispersal ways, and finds that: (i) Information regarding invasive insects in the GISD remains inadequate. Such harmful invasive species as Opogona sacchari (Bojer), Oracella acuta (Lobdell), and Dendroctonus valens LeConte are not included. (ii) Ten species of invasive insects, particularly Lasius neglectus Van Loon and Linepithema humile (Mayr) which become established in areas near China, have the potential to become established in China. (iii) Special attention should be paid to species from Asia and the Americas because of their greater likelihood of becoming established in China. Finally, some management strategies including legislation, quarantine, early warning, prevention and control are suggested.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "The Global Invasive Species Database (GISD) catalogs 27 of the world's most critical invasive alien insect species as of November 2005. Among these, six originate from China, eleven have made their way into China, and ten pose a potential threat of invasion. The analysis presented in this document reviews the distribution, impact, and spread of these species and highlights several key findings: Firstly, the coverage of invasive insect species within the GISD is found to be insufficient, missing critical species like Opogona sacchari (Bojer), Oracella acuta (Lobdell), and Dendroctonus valens LeConte. Secondly, there are ten invasive insect species, notably Lasius neglectus Van Loon and Linepithema humile (Mayr), that are positioned close to China and thus have a high risk of establishing themselves within Chinese borders. Thirdly, particular focus should be directed towards species originating from Asia and the Americas due to their high potential for establishment in China. The document concludes by recommending various management practices, including legal measures, quarantine procedures, early detection, and prevention and control strategies to mitigate these risks.", "named_entities": ["Global Invasive Species Database", "GISD", "Opogona sacchari", "Oracella acuta", "Dendroctonus valens LeConte", "Lasius neglectus Van Loon", "Linepithema humile"]}

original: original_corpus: 'The morbidity and mortality in thalassemia patients are predominantly caused by iron overload cardiomyopathy (IOC). Iron-induced cardiac intracellular Ca<sup>2+</sup> ([Ca<sup>2+</sup>]<sub>i</sub>) dysregulation is among the core pathophysiological processes in IOC-related heart failure. Although cardioprotective roles of deferiprone (DFP) and N-acetylcysteine (NAC) have been reported, their effect on cardiac [Ca<sup>2+</sup>]<sub>i</sub> transients and Ca<sup>2+</sup>-regulatory protein expression in thalassemic mice is unknown. In the present study, iron overload condition was induced in wild-type (WT) and heterozygous β-thalassemic (HT) mice by a high-iron diet. The iron-overloaded mice subsequently received a vehicle, DFP, NAC, or DFP plus NAC co-therapy. In both WT and HT iron-overloaded mice, DFP and NAC had similar efficacy in decreasing plasma non-transferrin-bound iron, decreasing cardiac iron concentration (CIC) and relieving systolic dysfunction. DFP plus NAC co-therapy, however, was better than the monotherapy in reducing CIC and restoring cardiac [Ca<sup>2+</sup>]<sub>i</sub> transient amplitude and rising rate. All regimens produced no change in cardiac Ca<sup>2+</sup>-regulatory protein expression. We provided the first evidence regarding the synergistic effect of combined iron chelator-antioxidant therapy on cardiac [Ca<sup>2+</sup>]<sub>i</sub> homeostasis in iron-overloaded thalassemic mice, with consistent improvement of cardiac contractility.'

original_corpus: 'Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) and mental illness are interlinked health problems; mental illness may pose a risk for contracting HIV and HIV-positive individuals are at higher risk of mental illness. However, in countries with high HIV prevalence, the main focus of HIV-related health programmes is usually on prevention and treatment of somatic complications of HIV, and mental illness is not given high priority. We examined HIV prevalence, uptake of HIV services, and HIV-related risk behaviour among people attending a mental health clinic in rural Malawi.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "The connection between Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) and mental illness represents a complex health challenge; individuals suffering from mental illness are at an increased risk of acquiring HIV, and those who are HIV-positive have a higher likelihood of developing mental health issues. Nonetheless, in nations where HIV is widespread, health initiatives primarily concentrate on preventing and treating the physical ailments associated with HIV, often overlooking mental health concerns. Our study focused on analyzing the prevalence of HIV, the engagement with HIV services, and behaviors related to HIV risk among patients at a mental health facility in rural Malawi.", "named_entities": ["Human immunodeficiency virus", "HIV", "mental illness", "Malawi"]}

original: original_corpus: 'The recent radionuclide measurements have showed that concentrations of the Chernobyl-derived (137)Cs and (90)Sr in the surface Black Sea waters are still relatively high, reaching 56 and 32Â BqÂ m(-3), respectively. This is comparable or even exceeds the pre-Chernobyl levels (âˆ¼16 Bq (137)Cs and 22 Bq (90)Sr per m(3) as the basin-wide average values). The measurements have revealed that the Black Sea continues to receive Chernobyl radionuclides, particularly (90)Sr, by the runoff from the Dnieper River. An additional source of (90)Sr and (137)Cs was found in the area adjacent to the Kerch Strait that connects the Black Sea and the Sea of Azov. This may be caused by the inflow of the contaminated Dnieper waters, which come to this area through the North-Crimean Canal. The long-term monitoring of (137)Cs and (90)Sr concentration in the Black Sea surface waters and in the benthic brown seaweed Cystoseira sp., in comparison with the earlier published sediment records of the radionuclides, have showed signs of a secondary radioactive contamination, which has started to increase since the late 1990's. This may be the result of the combined effect of a higher input of radionuclides from the rivers in 1995-1999 due to an increased runoff; and a slow transport of the particulate bound radionuclides from the watersheds followed by their desorption in seawater from the riverine suspended matter and remobilization from the sediments adjacent to the river mouths.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "Recent studies on radionuclide levels have indicated that the quantities of Chernobyl-originated (137)Cs and (90)Sr in the Black Sea's surface waters remain relatively elevated, achieving concentrations of 56 and 32Â BqÂ m(-3), respectively. These levels are on par with or surpass the average concentrations recorded before the Chernobyl incident, which were approximately 16 Bq (137)Cs and 22 Bq (90)Sr per cubic meter. It has been discovered that the Black Sea is still being polluted with Chernobyl radionuclides, especially (90)Sr, primarily due to discharge from the Dnieper River. Another significant source of (90)Sr and (137)Cs has been identified near the Kerch Strait, the waterway linking the Black Sea and the Sea of Azov, likely due to the transfer of contaminated waters from the Dnieper River through the North-Crimean Canal. Ongoing observations of the (137)Cs and (90)Sr levels in the surface waters of the Black Sea and in the benthic brown seaweed Cystoseira sp., when compared with previously reported sediment radionuclide data, have indicated the onset of secondary radioactive contamination beginning to escalate since the late 1990s. This uptick in contamination could stem from a combined effect of increased radionuclide delivery via rivers between 1995 and 1999 due to higher runoff, and the gradual movement of radionuclide-bound particles from watersheds, which are then released into the seawater from suspended river matter and reactivated from sediments near the river estuaries.", "named_entities": ["Chernobyl", "(137)Cs", "(90)Sr", "Black Sea", "Dnieper River", "Kerch Strait", "Sea of Azov", "North-Crimean Canal", "Cystoseira sp."]}

original: original_corpus: 'Biomarkers are key tools and can provide crucial information on the complex cascade of events and molecular mechanisms underlying traumatic brain injury (TBI) pathophysiology. Obtaining a profile of distinct classes of biomarkers reflecting core pathologic mechanisms could enable us to identify and characterize the initial injury and the secondary pathologic cascades. Thus, they represent a logical adjunct to improve diagnosis, track progression and activity, guide molecularly targeted therapy, and monitor therapeutic response in TBI. Accordingly, great effort has been put into the identification of novel biomarkers in the past 25 years. However, the role of brain injury markers in clinical practice has been long debated, due to inconsistent regulatory standards and lack of reliable evidence of analytical validity and clinical utility. We present a comprehensive overview of the markers currently available while characterizing their potential role and applications in diagnosis, monitoring, drug discovery, and clinical trials in TBI. In reviewing these concepts, we discuss the recent inclusion of brain damage biomarkers in the diagnostic guidelines and provide perspectives on the validation of such markers for their use in the clinic.'

original_corpus: 'Intracanalicular vestibular schwannomas (IVS) account for 8% of all vestibular schwannomas and their detection is still increasing due to high availability of magnetic resonance (MRI). Radiosurgery is one of several commonly acceptable methods of IVS treatment, but some risk may still exist with that treatment. The aim of this study is to analyze the clinical outcomes in tumor control and hearing preservation after radiosurgery of IVS. The retrospective analysis included 14 scientific papers available in the PubMed database. Assessment of tumor volume was performed based on gadolinium-enhanced T1-weighted scans. Hearing preservation was assessed using the Gardner-Robertson classification (GR class). Statistical analysis was performed using IBM SPSS Statistics 27. It was revealed that tumor growth control in IVS treated with radiosurgery was higher than in the wait-and-see strategy. The hearing preservation was similar in patients after wait and see and the surgical group. Radiosurgery was associated with low risk of facial nerve dysfunction.'

  "paraphrase_corpus": "Intracanalicular vestibular schwannomas (IVS), making up 8% of all vestibular schwannomas, are increasingly detected due to widespread use of magnetic resonance imaging (MRI). This study aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of radiosurgery in controlling tumor growth and preserving hearing in IVS patients. A review of 14 scholarly articles from the PubMed database was conducted. The measurement of tumor size was done using MRI scans enhanced with gadolinium, specifically T1-weighted images. The ability to maintain hearing was measured through the Gardner-Robertson classification system. Data analysis was carried out with IBM SPSS Statistics 27 software. The findings indicated that IVS patients who underwent radiosurgery showed better tumor growth control compared to those who followed a wait-and-see approach. Hearing preservation rates were found to be comparable between patients who chose to wait and those who underwent surgery. Radiosurgery was linked to a minimal risk of impairing facial nerve function.",

original: original_corpus: 'Background and objectives: Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) have been among the major causes of small intestinal injury in clinical practice. As such, the current study investigated the protective effect of 5-aminosalicylic acid (5-ASA) against an NSAID-induced small intestinal injury. Materials and Methods: IEC-6 cells were treated with various concentrations of indomethacin with or without 5-ASA in a serum-free medium, after which an 3-(4,5-Dimethylthiazol-2-yl)-2,5-Diphenyltetrazolium Dromide (MTT) assay, a cell apoptosis assay, a caspase-3 activity assay, a reactive oxygen species (ROS) content and Superoxide dismutase 2 (SOD2) activity measurement, a Western blotting for occludin and zonula occludens-1 (ZO-1) and a wound healing assay were conducted. Results: 5-ASA ameliorated indomethacin-induced cell apoptosis and an increase in the intracellular ROS content while augmenting the indomethacin-induced suppression of SOD2 activity in IEC-6 cells. Moreover, 5-ASA reversed the indomethacin-induced attenuation of occludin and ZO-1 expression and promoted faster wound healing effects in IEC-6 cells following an indomethacin-induced injury. Conclusion: Our results suggested that 5-ASA protects small intestinal cells against an NSAID-induced small intestinal injury by scavenging free radicals. Therefore, 5-ASA could be a potential treatment for an NSAID-induced small intestinal injury.'

{
  "paraphrase_corpus": "The study aimed to explore the protective role of 5-aminosalicylic acid (5-ASA) in preventing damage to the small intestine caused by non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), a common issue observed in clinical settings. Using IEC-6 cell lines, the research examined the impact of 5-ASA on cells exposed to indomethacin, an NSAID, in a serum-free environment. The investigation included assessments of cell health through an MTT assay, apoptosis evaluation, caspase-3 activity, levels of reactive oxygen species (ROS) and superoxide dismutase 2 (SOD2) activity, protein expression of occludin and zonula occludens-1 (ZO-1) via Western blot, and a wound healing assay. Findings revealed that 5-ASA effectively mitigated the apoptosis and ROS increases triggered by indomethacin while counteracting the reduction in SOD2 activity. Furthermore, 5-ASA corrected the decreased expression of occludin and ZO-1 caused by indomethacin and enhanced the repair of cell damage. The study concludes that 5-ASA acts as a protective agent for the small intestine against damage from NSAIDs by neutralizing free radicals, highlighting its potential as a therapeutic option for NSAID-induced small intestinal injuries.",

original: original_corpus: 'A highly performing proton conducting composite was prepared through the impregnation of EMIMCl ionic liquid in the mesoporous MIL-101(Cr)-SO3H MOF. The resulting EMIMCl@MIL-101(Cr)-SO3H composite displays high thermal and chemical stability, alongside retention of a high amount of EMIMCl even at temperatures as high as 500 K, as well as under moisture conditions. Remarkably, this composite exhibits outstanding proton conductivity not only at the anhydrous state (σ473 K = 1.5 × 10-3 S cm-S) but also under humidity (σ(343 K/60%-80%RH) ≥ 0.10 S cm-1) conditions. This makes EMIMCl@MIL-101(Cr)-SO3H a unique candidate to act as a solid state proton conductor for PEMFC applications under versatile conditions.'

original: original_corpus: 'Interest in the application of systems science (SS) in biomedical research, particularly regarding obesity and noncommunicable chronic disease (NCD) research, has been growing rapidly over the past decade. SS is a broad term referring to a family of research approaches that include modeling. As an emerging approach being adopted in public health, SS focuses on the complex dynamic interaction between agents (e.g., people) and subsystems defined at different levels. SS provides a conceptual framework for interdisciplinary and transdisciplinary approaches that address complex problems. SS has unique advantages for studying obesity and NCD problems in comparison to the traditional analytic approaches. The application of SS in biomedical research dates back to the 1960s with the development of computing capacity and simulation software. In recent decades, SS has been applied to addressing the growing global obesity epidemic. There is growing appreciation and support for using SS in the public health field, with many promising opportunities. There are also many challenges and uncertainties, including methodologic, funding, and institutional barriers. Integrated efforts by stakeholders that address these challenges are critical for the successful application of SS in the future.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "The use of systems science (SS) in the field of biomedical research, especially in studies related to obesity and noncommunicable chronic diseases (NCDs), has seen a significant rise over the last ten years. SS encompasses a wide range of research methods that primarily involve modeling and is increasingly being recognized for its potential in public health. It examines the intricate interactions between various agents (for example, individuals) and subsystems across different levels, providing a framework that encourages interdisciplinary and transdisciplinary solutions to complex issues. SS stands out for its distinctive benefits in exploring the complexities of obesity and NCDs, offering insights that conventional analytical methods may not. The incorporation of SS into biomedical research began in the 1960s, spurred by advances in computer technology and simulation tools. In more recent years, SS has been directed towards tackling the global rise in obesity, gaining acknowledgment and backing for its application in public health. Despite the promising prospects of SS, there are several hurdles to its broader adoption, including methodological challenges, funding limitations, and institutional obstacles. Addressing these issues through collective efforts from all stakeholders is essential for the future success of SS applications.", "named_entities": ["systems science (SS)", "biomedical research", "obesity", "noncommunicable chronic diseases (NCDs)", "public health"]}

original: original_corpus: 'Epidemiologic studies have reported that moderate alcohol consumption is inversely associated with the risk of renal cancer. However, there is no information available on the associations in renal cancer subsites. From 1992 through to 2010, 477,325 men and women in the European Prospective Investigation into Cancer and Nutrition cohort were followed for incident renal cancers (nâ€‰=â€‰931). Baseline and lifetime alcohol consumption was assessed by country-specific, validated dietary questionnaires. Information on past alcohol consumption was collected by lifestyle questionnaires. Hazard ratios (HRs) and 95% confidence intervals (CIs) were estimated from Cox proportional hazard models. In multivariate analysis, total alcohol consumption at baseline was inversely associated with renal cancer; the HR and 95% CI for the increasing categories of total alcohol consumption at recruitment versus the light drinkers category were 0.78 (0.62-0.99), 0.82 (0.64-1.04), 0.70 (0.55-0.90), 0.91 (0.63-1.30), respectively, (ptrend â€‰=â€‰0.001). A similar relationship was observed for average lifetime alcohol consumption and for all renal cancer subsites combined or for renal parenchyma subsite. The trend was not observed in hypertensive individuals and not significant in smokers. In conclusion, moderate alcohol consumption was associated with a decreased risk of renal cancer.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "Epidemiological research has indicated that consuming alcohol in moderation may lower the risk of kidney cancer. Yet, data on how this consumption affects different areas of kidney cancer is lacking. Between 1992 and 2010, a study followed 477,325 participants within the European Prospective Investigation into Cancer and Nutrition project, tracking 931 instances of kidney cancer. Initial and lifelong alcohol intake was evaluated using validated dietary questionnaires specific to each participating country, alongside lifestyle questionnaires that gathered data on previous alcohol use. Through Cox proportional hazard models, hazard ratios (HRs) and 95% confidence intervals (CIs) were calculated. The multivariate analysis showed that alcohol consumption at the start of the study inversely correlated with the incidence of kidney cancer; HR and 95% CI for increasing levels of alcohol intake compared to those who drank minimally were 0.78 (0.62-0.99), 0.82 (0.64-1.04), 0.70 (0.55-0.90), and 0.91 (0.63-1.30), respectively, with a significant trend (ptrend = 0.001). This inverse association was consistent across average lifetime alcohol consumption and for all kidney cancer areas, especially the renal parenchyma. However, this trend did not appear in individuals with hypertension and was not significant among smokers. The study concluded that a moderate level of alcohol consumption could be linked with a lower kidney cancer risk.", "named_entities": ["Epidemiologic studies", "renal cancer", "European Prospective Investigation into Cancer and Nutrition", "Cox proportional hazard models", "renal parenchyma"]}

original: original_corpus: 'Ionic liquid mixed hemimicelles-based solid-phase extraction for the preconcentration of five phthalates in environmental water sample was investigated in this paper. A comparative study on the use of room temperature ionic liquids (RTILs) 1-hexyl-3-methylimidazolium bromide ([C(6)mim]Br) and 1-dodecyl-3-methylimidazolium bromide ([C(12)mim]Br)-coated silica as sorbents was presented. Owing to having bigger adsorption amounts for analytes [C(12)mim], Br-coated silica was selected as SPE material and the five analytes di-ethyl-phthalate (DEP), di-n-propyl-phthalate (DnPP), di-n-butyl-phthalate (DnBP), di-cyclohexyl-phthalate (DcHP) and di-(2-ethylhexyl)-phthalate (DEHP) can be quantitatively extracted under optimal conditions. The analytes retained on the cartridge were desorbed completely with 3mL methanol (pH 2). Predominant factors influencing the extraction efficiency, such as RTILs concentration, pH value, ionic strength and breakthrough volume were discussed. The proposed method had been applied to determining the five phthalates in four environmental water samples and concentration factor of 600 was achieved easily. Detection limits obtained ranged between 0.12 and 0.17mug/L. The accuracy of this method was evaluated by recovery measurement on spiked samples, and good recovery results (85-107%) with relative standard deviation (R.S.D.) of below 6% were achieved.'

It compares the efficiency of two room temperature ionic liquids (RTILs), 1-hexyl-3-methylimidazolium bromide ([C(6)mim]Br) and 1-dodecyl-3-methylimidazolium bromide ([C(12)mim]Br), when used as coatings for silica sorbents. The [C(12)mim]Br-coated silica, which showed a greater capacity for adsorbing the compounds, was chosen as the solid-phase extraction (SPE) material. Under optimal conditions, it could quantitatively extract five specific analytes: di-ethyl-phthalate (DEP), di-n-propyl-phthalate (DnPP), di-n-butyl-phthalate (DnBP), di-cyclohexyl-phthalate (DcHP), and di-(2-ethylhexyl)-phthalate (DEHP). The analytes adsorbed onto the cartridge were fully desorbed using 3mL of methanol at pH 2. The study also reviewed key factors that impact extraction efficiency including RTIL concentration, pH, ionic strength, and breakthrough volume. Applied to four environmental water samples, the method achieved a concentration factor of 600 and detection limits between 0.12 and 0.17 Âµg/L. original: original_corpus: 'Injections of the selective D2 dopamine agonist bromocriptine (5.0 mg/kg, IP) produced progressively stronger locomotion over 10 days of repeated testing. Concurrent treatment with either the D1 antagonist SCH 23390 (0.01 or 0.1 mg/kg, IP) or the D2 antagonist raclopride (0.1 or 1.0 mg/kg, IP) suppressed bromocriptine-induced locomotion on treatment days and attenuated or blocked the progressive increases in locomotion that accompanied repeated injections of bromocriptine alone. The fact that D1 and D2 antagonists each block the acute actions of bromocriptine and attenuate the development of bromocriptine sensitization is suggested to imply a striatal rather than a ventral tegmental mechanism for the sensitization produced by repeated treatments with direct dopamine agonists.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "Administering a specific dose of the D2 dopamine agonist, bromocriptine (5.0 mg/kg, IP), led to increasingly pronounced movement over a series of 10 daily tests. The simultaneous administration of either a D1 antagonist, SCH 23390 (0.01 or 0.1 mg/kg, IP), or a D2 antagonist, raclopride (0.1 or 1.0 mg/kg, IP), significantly reduced the movement caused by bromocriptine on the days of treatment and diminished or prevented the gradual intensification of movement observed with successive bromocriptine injections. The ability of both D1 and D2 antagonists to inhibit the immediate effects of bromocriptine and reduce the development of bromocriptine sensitization points to a striatal, rather than ventral tegmental, mechanism underlying the increased responsiveness resulting from repeated administration of direct dopamine agonists.", "named_entities": ["D2 dopamine agonist", "bromocriptine", "D1 antagonist", "SCH 23390", "D2 antagonist", "raclopride", "striatal", "ventral tegmental"]}

original: original_corpus: 'Preeclampsia/eclampsia, also known as toxemia of pregnancy, remains one of the great triad of obstetric complications. The outlook for the preeclamptic woman and the fetus has improved as a result of increased knowledge of uteroplacental-fetal physiology and of the physiologic deviations involved in preeclampsia, although the  basic cause of preeclampsia remains unknown. Careful screening of women at risk for preeclampsia along with early detection and treatment can help reduce the toll taken in stillbirths, prematurity, and maternal death. Current concepts of pathophysiology are reviewed as is nursing care during the antepartum and intrapartum periods.'

original_corpus: 'Different G(1) cyclins confer functional specificity to the cyclin-dependent kinase (Cdk) Cdc28p in budding yeast. The Cln3p G(1) cyclin is localized primarily to the nucleus, while Cln2p is localized primarily to the cytoplasm. Both binding to Cdc28p and Cdc28p-dependent phosphorylation in the C-terminal region of Cln2p are independently required for efficient nuclear depletion of Cln2p, suggesting that this process may be physiologically regulated. The accumulation of hypophosphorylated Cln2 in the nucleus is an energy-dependent process, but may not involve the RAN GTPase. Phosphorylation of Cln2p is inefficient in small newborn cells obtained by elutriation, and this lowered phosphorylation correlates with reduced Cln2p nuclear depletion in newborn cells. Thus, Cln2p may have a brief period of nuclear residence early in the cell cycle. In contrast, the nuclear localization pattern of Cln3p is not influenced by Cdk activity. Cln3p localization requires a bipartite nuclear localization signal (NLS) located at the C terminus of the protein. This sequence is required for nuclear localization of Cln3p and is sufficient to confer nuclear localization to green fluorescent protein in a RAN-dependent manner. Mislocalized Cln3p, lacking the NLS, is much less active in genetic assays specific for Cln3p, but more active in assays normally specific for Cln2p, consistent with the idea that Cln3p localization explains a significant part of Clnp functional specificity.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "In budding yeast, different G(1) cyclins bestow distinct functionalities upon the cyclin-dependent kinase Cdc28p. The Cln3p G(1) cyclin predominantly resides in the nucleus, whereas Cln2p is mainly found in the cytoplasm. The processes of binding to Cdc28p and Cdc28p-mediated phosphorylation at the C-terminal of Cln2p are both essential for Cln2p's efficient removal from the nucleus, indicating that this mechanism might be under physiological regulation. The build-up of less phosphorylated Cln2 in the nucleus is an energy-requiring process, which apparently does not involve the RAN GTPase. In small, newly formed cells separated by elutriation, phosphorylation of Cln2p is less efficient, and this reduction in phosphorylation is associated with a decreased movement of Cln2p out of the nucleus in these newborn cells. Therefore, Cln2p appears to spend a short time in the nucleus at the beginning of the cell cycle. However, the nuclear presence of Cln3p is not affected by Cdk activity. The nuclear location of Cln3p is dependent on a two-part nuclear localization signal (NLS) at the protein's C-terminal, which is necessary for Cln3p's nuclear presence and can also direct green fluorescent protein to the nucleus in a RAN-dependent way. Mislocated Cln3p, missing the NLS, reveals reduced effectiveness in genetic tests designed for Cln3p but displays increased activity in tests usually specific for Cln2p. This suggests that the positioning of Cln3p contributes significantly to the distinct roles of Clnp cyclins.", "named_entities": ["Cdc28p", "Cln2p", "nuclear localization signal (NLS)", "RAN GTPase", "green fluorescent protein"]}

original: original_corpus: 'It has been long known that uremia and RDT could alter the optical fibers of the Central Nervous System: we also previously demonstrated the persistence of a delayed P100 wave evoked by Visual Potentials (VEPs) in RDT patients. Our present study evaluates changes in IOP during RDT and possible correlations between electrophysiological and tonometrical modifications. In twenty patients undergoing RDT (12 hrs/weekly, mean age 42.05 +/- 10.80 yrs) we performed, just before and immediately after the dialytic session the tonographic recordings and serum osmolality. The pre-dialysis IOP of all 20 patients ranged from 9.00 to 27.19 mmHg with a mean of 16.40 +/- 7.20. Serum osmolality predialysis was 326.10 +/- 5.72 mOsm/l and post-dialysis 290.33 +/- 2.95 mOsm/l. Our studies suggest a correlation between decrease in plasma osmolality and increase in IOP during dialysis. The effect of RDT on IOP depends on the balance between the rise in IOP with the reduction of the concentrations of "waste products" and the extracellular volume reduction associated with ultrafiltration. The elevation of IOP may be due to a decrease in post-dialysis outflow facility inducing an osmotic influx of water into the eye because of hyperosmolality of intraocular fluids. These continuous modifications may be partially responsible for the defective propagation and the delayed transmission documented by VEPs.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "For a long time, it has been recognized that uremia and RDT have the capacity to modify the optical fibers within the Central Nervous System. Additionally, our prior research has highlighted the continued presence of a delayed P100 wave triggered by Visual Evoked Potentials (VEPs) in patients undergoing RDT. The current study was aimed at assessing the variations in Intraocular Pressure (IOP) during RDT sessions and exploring the potential links between electrophysiological changes and those measured tonometrically. In a group of twenty individuals receiving RDT treatment (12 hours weekly, average age 42.05 Â± 10.80 years), tonographic measurements and serum osmolality levels were evaluated both before and immediately after dialysis treatments. The initial IOP values for all participants ranged between 9.00 and 27.19 mmHg, averaging at 16.40 Â± 7.20. Serum osmolality before dialysis stood at 326.10 Â± 5.72 mOsm/l, which decreased to 290.33 Â± 2.95 mOsm/l following the procedure. The findings indicate a relationship between the reduction in plasma osmolality and an uptick in IOP during the dialysis process. The impact of RDT on IOP seems to hinge on a complex interplay involving an increase in IOP as waste product concentrations drop and extracellular volume decreases due to ultrafiltration. The surge in IOP can be attributed to a reduced outflow facility post-dialysis, leading to an osmotic influx of water into the ocular chamber as a result of the intraocular fluids' hyperosmolality. These ongoing changes could play a role in the observed anomalies in signal propagation and the delayed transmission seen in VEP studies.", "named_entities": ["uremia", "RDT", "Central Nervous System", "P100 wave", "Visual Evoked Potentials (VEPs)", "Intraocular Pressure (IOP)", "serum osmolality"]}

original: original_corpus: 'A 5-day method for determining the soluble silicon (Si) concentrations in nonliquid fertilizer products was developed using a sodium carbonate (Na2CO3)-ammonium nitrate (NH4NO3) extractant followed by visible spectroscopy with heteropoly blue analysis at 660 nm. The 5-Day Na2CO3-NH4NO3 Soluble Si Extraction Method can be applied to quantify the plant-available Si in solid fertilizer products at levels ranging from 0.2 to 8.4% Si with an LOD of 0.06%, and LOQ of 0.20%. This Si extraction method for fertilizers correlates well with plant uptake of Si (r2 = 0.96 for a range of solid fertilizers) and is applicable to solid Si fertilizer products including blended products and beneficial substances. Fertilizer materials can be processed as received using commercially available laboratory chemicals and materials at ambient laboratory temperatures. The single-laboratory validation of the 5-Day Na2CO3-NH4NO3 Soluble Si Extraction Method has been approved by The Association of American Plant Food Control Officials for testing nonliquid Si fertilizer products.'

original_corpus: 'The addition of 2 mM sodium butyrate to monolayers enhances differentiation of Ishikawa endometrial cells. Cells from this cell line have been shown to enlarge and lift off the dish into dome structures over a period of 24-48 h in response to a factor in fetal bovine serum (FBS) [Fleming, 1995 J Cell Biochem in press]. When butyrate is added to monolayers, together with FBS, three- to fourfold higher numbers of differentiated structures, domes and predomes, can be counted. It had previously been shown [Holinka et al., 1986b] that estradiol induces heat stable placental alkaline phosphatase in Ishikawa cells. The addition of butyrate, on the other hand, results in a significant increase in levels of a heat labile alkaline phosphatase isozyme. The heat labile isozyme is also increased to some extent in cells stimulated to differentiate in response to FBS in the absence of butyrate. Differential inhibition by homoarginine and phenylalanine indicates that butyrate is inducing the liver-bone kidney isozyme that is found in endometrial glands in vivo.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "Introducing 2 mM of sodium butyrate into monolayers significantly promotes the differentiation of Ishikawa endometrial cells. This cell line, upon treatment, exhibits cell enlargement and detachment, forming dome-like structures within 24-48 hours due to an element present in fetal bovine serum (FBS). The presence of butyrate, alongside FBS, results in a three to four times increase in the number of differentiated structures, such as domes and predomes. Prior research had demonstrated that estradiol triggers the production of heat stable placental alkaline phosphatase in these cells. Conversely, butyrate's addition markedly elevates a heat-sensitive alkaline phosphatase isozyme. This particular isozyme also sees a rise in levels when cells undergo differentiation due to FBS alone, without butyrate. The differential blockage caused by homoarginine and phenylalanine suggests butyrate's role in promoting the liver-bone kidney isozyme, which naturally occurs in the endometrial glands in the body.", "named_entities": ["sodium butyrate", "Ishikawa endometrial cells", "fetal bovine serum (FBS)", "estradiol", "placental alkaline phosphatase", "liver-bone kidney isozyme"]}

original: original_corpus: 'Bone metastasis is a common complication of cancer, and bone is the third most common metastatic site following the lung and liver. Among the various bones, spine is the most common site of metastatic tumors. The treatment goals of patients with spinal metastases are mostly palliative, with the aim of reducing pain and improving quality of life. The treatment of spinal metastases has made significant progress over the past few decades. Each new technology has tried to solve the shortcomings of its predecessors. Currently, there are no mature algorithms or specific techniques that have proven to be the best for spinal metastases, and the treatment method often relies on operator and institutional preferences or biases in some cases. Percutaneous vertebral augmentation has unique value in the management of spinal metastases, understanding its indications, surgical techniques, uses, advantages and complications is critical to providing optimal patient care. We believe that the application of percutaneous vertebral augmentation alone or combined with other techniques can achieve optimal pain relief and functional improvement in the patients with spinal metastases.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "Bone metastasis frequently occurs in cancer patients, ranking as the third most frequent site for cancer spread after the lung and liver. The spine stands out as the primary location for metastatic cancer cells within the bone structure. For individuals with spinal metastases, treatment aims are largely focused on palliation, striving to alleviate pain and enhance the quality of life. Over recent years, treatments for spinal metastases have advanced considerably, with each innovation addressing the limitations of previous methods. Presently, no definitive algorithms or methodologies have been universally accepted as superior for treating spinal metastases, and choices regarding treatment often depend on the preferences or potential biases of the medical provider or institution. Percutaneous vertebral augmentation holds a distinct importance in managing spinal metastases, and a comprehensive understanding of when and how to use this technique, along with its benefits and possible complications, is vital for delivering the best care to patients. It is our view that using percutaneous vertebral augmentation, whether as a standalone treatment or in conjunction with other methods, can provide significant pain reduction and functional enhancement for patients suffering from spinal metastases.", "named_entities": ["Bone metastasis", "spinal metastases", "Percutaneous vertebral augmentation"]}

original: original_corpus: 'Provider burnout is a significant health care concern. It is unclear whether high reliability organization (HRO) practices can prevent it. The Truman Veterans Affairs Medical Center (VAMC) undertook an initiative implementing HRO principles and assessed for impact on burnout metrics. This became known as the Transformative HRO Initiative Via Employee Engagement (THRIVE2) model. THRIVE2 consisted of Just Culture training, Clinical Team Training, and continuous process improvement through Lean. Truman VAMC was compared with other Veterans Health Affairs (VHA) facilities regarding burnout and employee satisfaction metrics. Truman VAMC saw significant changes in multiple HRO metrics (P < 0.001) as well as improvements in work group psychological safety and employee exhaustion (P < 0.001). High burnout rates decreased by 52% (6.2%-2.95%; P < 0.001). Truman VAMC went from 75th to the No. 1 ranked VHA facility regarding Best Places to Work. These findings have significant national policy implications given the effects of burnout.'

THRIVE2 included initiatives such as Just Culture training, Clinical Team Training, and ongoing process improvement utilizing Lean methodologies. When compared to other Veterans Health Affairs (VHA) facilities, Truman VAMC observed notable improvements in several HRO-related metrics, as well as enhancements in team psychological safety and reductions in employee exhaustion, all showing significant statistical improvements. The rate of high burnout among employees was cut by more than half, leading to Truman VAMC's rise from the 75th position to the top-ranked position in the VHA's Best Places to Work. original: original_corpus: 'Thirty 5-month-old red-legged partridges (Alectoris rufa) reared in battery were divided into five groups: 4 birds in group A, 14 birds in group B, 4 birds in group C, 4 birds in group D and 4 birds in group E, and were inoculated orally with 10, 50, 10(2), 10(3) and 10(4) oocysts of the OV-51/95 strain of Toxoplasma gondii, respectively. During the experiment, blood samples from all birds were drawn every 3-7 days and at necropsy. Serologic response was measured by the modified agglutination test (MAT) and the latex agglutination test (LAT). One bird from each group was killed at 44, 58, 65 and 72 days after inoculation (DAI). From 72 DAI to the end of the experiment, surviving partridges from group B were killed at weekly intervals. The last partridges were sacrified 100 DAI. MAT was the most sensitive and specific test for detecting T. gondii antibodies in the birds. First positive titers were detected by MAT in all sera on 7 DAI, but titers by LAT did not appear until 13 DAI. Antibody titers detected by MAT on 7 DAI were higher in the partridges with the largest inocula (10(3) or 10(4) oocysts) than those inoculated with 10, 50 or 10(2) oocysts. All surviving birds developed a serologic response to T. gondii, with maximum titers of 512-32,768 in the MAT on 13-17 DAI, and positive titers persisted at least until 100 DAI. To the contrary, LAT reveals only very low antibody titers even in partridges inoculated with the highest dose of T. gondii.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "Thirty red-legged partridges (Alectoris rufa), 5 months of age and raised in battery conditions, were split into five groups: Group A with 4 birds, Group B with 14 birds, and Groups C, D, and E each with 4 birds. They were orally administered doses of 10, 50, 100, 1,000, and 10,000 oocysts of the Toxoplasma gondii OV-51/95 strain, respectively. Throughout the study, blood samples were collected from all partridges every 3 to 7 days and at the time of necropsy. The serological responses were assessed using the modified agglutination test (MAT) and the latex agglutination test (LAT). One bird from each group was euthanized on days 44, 58, 65, and 72 post-inoculation. Starting from 72 days post-inoculation until the experiment concluded, the remaining birds in group B were euthanized at weekly intervals, with the final partridges being sacrificed at 100 days post-inoculation. MAT proved to be the most reliable method for identifying antibodies against T. gondii in the partridges, revealing first positive titers in all tested sera by the 7th day post-inoculation, whereas LAT did not detect antibodies until the 13th day. Birds inoculated with larger doses (1,000 or 10,000 oocysts) showed higher initial antibody titers by MAT compared to those receiving lower doses. All surviving birds exhibited a serological response to T. gondii, achieving peak antibody titers between 512 and 32,768 in the MAT between days 13 and 17 post-inoculation, with positive titers lasting at least until 100 days post-inoculation. In contrast, the LAT only detected very low antibody titers, even in birds that received the highest dose of T. gondii.", "named_entities": ["Alectoris rufa", "Toxoplasma gondii", "OV-51/95", "modified agglutination test (MAT)", "latex agglutination test (LAT)"]}

original: original_corpus: 'Primary hyperparathyroidism is a common endocrine disorder caused by parathyroid gland enlargement and excessive parathyroid hormone (PTH) secretion. However, the precise mechanisms of tumorigenesis of the parathyroids are unknown. Here we have investigated the roles of transforming growth factor (TGF)-beta and menin, the product of the multiple endocrine neoplasia type 1 (Men1) gene, in the proliferation and PTH production of parathyroid cells from either patients with secondary hyperparathyroidism or Men1. TGF-beta was expressed in the parathyroid endocrine cells. Addition of TGF-beta to parathyroid cells from patients with secondary hyperparathyroidism inhibited their proliferation and PTH secretion. These responses to TGF-beta were lost when menin was specifically inactivated by antisense oligonucleotides. Moreover, TGF-beta did not affect the proliferation and PTH production of parathyroid cells from a Men1 patient. These results indicate that menin is required for TGF-beta action in the parathyroid. We conclude that TGF-beta is an important autocrine/paracrine negative regulator of parathyroid cell proliferation and PTH secretion and that loss of TGF-beta signaling due to menin inactivation contributes to parathyroid tumorigenesis.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "Primary hyperparathyroidism is an often-seen hormonal imbalance disorder, originating from the overgrowth of the parathyroid glands and excessive production of parathyroid hormone (PTH). The exact causes of parathyroid cancer remain unclear. In this study, we explored how transforming growth factor (TGF)-beta and menin, which is synthesized by the gene responsible for multiple endocrine neoplasia type 1 (Men1), influence the growth and PTH secretion in parathyroid cells from individuals with either secondary hyperparathyroidism or Men1. We found that TGF-beta was present in the cells of the parathyroid gland. Introducing TGF-beta to parathyroid cells from patients with secondary hyperparathyroidism resulted in a reduction of both cell growth and PTH output. These effects of TGF-beta were negated when menin was deactivated using antisense oligonucleotides. Additionally, TGF-beta had no impact on the cell growth and PTH secretion in parathyroid cells from a patient with Men1. These findings suggest that menin plays a crucial role in mediating the effects of TGF-beta in the parathyroid glands. It is concluded that TGF-beta serves as a significant self-regulating negative influence on the growth of parathyroid cells and their secretion of PTH, and that the disabling of TGF-beta signals through the inactivation of menin is a contributing factor to the development of parathyroid tumors.", "named_entities": ["Primary hyperparathyroidism", "parathyroid hormone (PTH)", "transforming growth factor (TGF)-beta", "menin", "multiple endocrine neoplasia type 1 (Men1)", "antisense oligonucleotides", "TGF-beta"]}

original: original_corpus: 'Cephaloridin (ceporin of "Pliva", Yugoslavia) was used in the treatment of patients after allotransplantation of the kidney from a cadaver during the early postoperative period with a purpose of prevention (5 patients) and therapy of complications, such as pneumonia (7 patients), sepsis (3 patients), pyelonephritis of the transplanted kidney (4 patients). The drug levels in the blood serum and urine were determined 1, 2, 4, 6, 8 and 24 hours after the administration. The drug was used with regard for the transplant function estimated by the data of the glomerular filtration and concentration of the nitrous residues in the blood. The antibiotic dose depended on the transplant function. The study provided some recommendations as for the ceporin use in therapy of such population of patients.'

original_corpus: 'Neuromyelitis optica (NMO) is a disease characterised by severe relapses of optic neuritis and longitudinally extensive transverse myelitis and it has a strong female predilection. Pain is one of the most typical symptom in NMO. However, few studies have been conducted to examine the neuropathic pain mechanism of NMO patients or gender-specific effects using magnetic resonance imaging technique. A total of 38 female patients with NMO, 28 with pain (NMOWP) and 10 without pain (NMOWoP), were classified using the Brief Pain Inventory (BPI); 22 healthy females were also recruited. We used the FSL Image Registration and Segmentation Toolbox (FIRST) for subcortical region volumes quantifications, and voxel-based morphometry analysis for cortical gray matter (GM) volume, to examine the brain morphology in NMOWP patients. In addition, correlation test between structural measurements of NMO patients and clinical indexes was also performed. The results showed: 1) no significant differences in cortical GM density between the NMOWP and NMOWoP groups; 2) significantly smaller hippocampus and pallidum volumes in the NMOWP group compared with the NMOWoP group; 3) significant negative correlation between the average BPI and volumes of the accumbens nucleus and thalamus in NMO patients. These results revealed that structural abnormality exists in NMO female patients who have pain, with significant implications for our understanding of the brain morphology in NMO patients with pain.'

original_corpus: 'H syndrome is a multisystem inflammatory disease caused by mutations in the SLC29A3 gene (OMIM #602782). The protein product, hENT3, is a nucleoside transporter essential for DNA salvage synthesis. Clinical manifestations are hyperpigmentation, hypertrichosis, hepatosplenomegaly, hearing loss, heart anomalies, hypogonadism, short stature, skeletal deformities, and diabetes mellitus. Laboratory findings are consistent with inflammatory processes. Structural kidney anomalies have been described in 6% of patients.'

original_corpus: 'In this issue of the Biomedical Journal, we highlight a review revealing that the effect of autophagy, reactive oxygen species, and antioxidants in cancer may be a question of timing and context. We also discuss original research showing that the prevalence of cleft lip with or without palate in Taiwan has declined over the past 20 years, and what this might mean in terms of trends in abortion. Finally, we also learn about risk factors for recurrent hospital-acquired infection with multi-drug resistant bacteria, and the value of dental screening for patients with tinnitus.'

original_corpus: 'Granulomatous slack skin (GSS) represents a rare variant of mycosis fungoides, histologically characterized by a variably deep T helper lymphocytes infiltrate with alteration of the dermal elastic tissue and consequent elastolysis, elastophagocytosis and numerous giant cells. Clinically, a development of unelastic, slack skin, especially on flexural areas, is observed. Hereby, we describe a man with a 12-year history of GSS. In 2002, for practical (limitation of movement, deambulation) and cosmetic reasons, he underwent the surgical excision of loose and sagging skinfold over inguinal area, and, afterwards, of the opposite affected inguinal skin. The surgical treatment of bilateral inguinal hernia with reposition of inguinal dislocated vasculature is also reported. In both cases the excised material confirmed the former diagnosis of GSS and revealed a very deep, muscular infiltrate of neoplastic lymphocytes. One year later, a new excision of GSS on the axillae was made. Now, after 2 years, deambulation keeps improving, although an initial relapse of the inguinal slack skin has been observed.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "Granulomatous slack skin (GSS) is a rare type of mycosis fungoides, distinguished histologically by a deep infiltration of T helper lymphocytes that leads to changes in dermal elastic tissue, resulting in elastolysis, elastophagocytosis, and the presence of numerous giant cells. Clinically, this condition manifests as inelastic, sagging skin, particularly in areas that bend. This document recounts the experience of a male patient with a 12-year history of GSS. In 2002, due to limited mobility and for aesthetic reasons, he underwent surgery to remove a drooping skinfold in the inguinal region, followed by a procedure on the opposite inguinal area. Additionally, he received surgical treatment for bilateral inguinal hernia, which involved repositioning displaced vasculature in the groin. The surgeries confirmed the GSS diagnosis and uncovered an extensive, muscular infiltration of cancerous lymphocytes in both instances. A year after, further GSS excisions were performed on the axillae. Two years on, the patientâ€™s ability to walk has continued to improve, though a recurrence of slack skin in the inguinal area has been noted.", "named_entities": ["Granulomatous slack skin", "mycosis fungoides", "T helper lymphocytes", "elastolysis", "elastophagocytosis", "inguinal hernia"]}

original: original_corpus: 'A high degree of specialization between host and parasite is a well-known outcome of a long history of coevolution, and it is strikingly illustrated in a coordination of their life cycles. In some cases, the arms race ensued at the establishment of a symbiotic relationship results in the adoption of manipulative strategies by the parasite. We have already learned that Steinina ctenocephali, a gregarine living in the alimentary canal of cat flea, Ctenocephalides felis follows its phenology and metamorphosis. Despite these findings the outcome of their symbiotic partnership (mutualist, parasitic or commensal) remains unclear. To address this important question, we measured life history parameters of the flea in the presence of varying infection intensities of gregarine oocysts in laboratory conditions. We found that neither the emergence nor survival rate of fleas was affected by harbouring the gregarines. More surprisingly, our results show that flea larvae infected with gregarines developed faster and emerged earlier than the control group. This gregarine therefore joins the selected group of protists that can modify physiological host traits and provides not only new model taxa to be explored in an evolutionary scenario, but also potential development of control strategies of cat flea.'

original_corpus: 'The intracerebral microinjection technique was used to localize sites in the brain where morphine facilitated the self-stimulation rate at hypothalamic electrode sites. Bilateral injections of morphine (2 x 1 microgram) into the ventral tegmental area and substantia nigra produced the strongest enhancement at the shortest latencies. At these sites, bilateral injections of 200 ng of morphine also produced a significant enhancement whereas a dose of 50 ng was below threshold for the rate increasing effect. The enhancement by morphine was effectively antagonized by naloxone (5 mg/kg). When injected bilaterally into the same area, D-Ala2-Met5-enkephalinamide (2 x 1 microgram) also induced a strong enhancement of self-stimulation lasting for 70 minutes. A possible dopaminergic substrate for the opiate induced behavioral stimulation is discussed.'

original_corpus: 'The effects of 13 soybean varieties (356, M4, M7, M9, Clark, Sahar, JK, BP, Williams, L17, Zane, Gorgan3, and DPX) on nutritional indices of the cotton bollworm, Helicoverpa armigera (HÃ¼bner) (Lepidoptera: Noctuidae), were determined at 25 Â± 1Â° C, 65 Â± 5% RH and a photoperiod of 16:8 L:D. Fourth instar larvae reared on Zane showed the highest efficiency of conversion of digested food (ECD) and approximate digestibility (AD) values (0.299 and 0.867, respectively) compared with other varieties. The lowest value of ECD and food consumed (FC) was on 356 (0.133 and 53.82 mg, respectively). The highest and lowest efficiency of conversion of ingested food (ECI) of fifth instar larvae (0.235 and 0.156, respectively) were on Zane and M4, respectively. The ECI and ECD values of whole larval instars were the highest on M7 (0.524 and 0.820, respectively) and lowest on Sahar (0.279 and 0.353, respectively). However, the highest and lowest value of consumption index (CI) was on M7 (7.351) and BP (3.462). Among the different varieties of soybean, the highest AD value was on M9 (0.858), and the lowest was on Zane (0.597). The results indicated that M4, Sahar, and JK were partially resistant to H. armigera.'

When fed on the Zane variety, fourth instar larvae exhibited the best efficiency in converting digested food (ECD) and showed the highest approximate digestibility (AD) rates (0.299 and 0.867, respectively) in comparison to other varieties. The 356 variety recorded the minimum ECD and food consumption (FC) figures (0.133 and 53.82 mg, respectively). In fifth instar larvae, the most and least efficient conversion of ingested food (ECI) were noted in larvae fed on Zane and M4 varieties (0.235 and 0.156, respectively). original: original_corpus: 'Accurate outcome prediction in Intensive Care Units (ICUs) would allow for better treatment planning, risk adjustment of study populations, and overall improvements in patient care. In the past, prognostic models have focused on mortality using simple ordinal severity of illness scores which could be tabulated manually by a human. With the improvements in computing power and proliferation of electronic medical records, entirely new approaches have become possible. Here we review the latest advances in outcome prediction, paying close attention to methods which are widely applicable and provide a high-level overview of the challenges the field currently faces.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "Making precise predictions about patient outcomes in Intensive Care Units (ICUs) could enhance treatment strategies, adjust for risk in research subjects, and lead to better care for patients. Previously, models predicting the future state of patients mainly concentrated on the likelihood of mortality, relying on basic, rank-based severity scores that could be computed by hand. However, with the rise in computational capabilities and the widespread adoption of digital health records, entirely new predictive methodologies have emerged. This discussion highlights the most recent progress in predicting patient outcomes, with a special emphasis on techniques that have broad applicability and provides an insight into the current obstacles encountered by researchers in this domain.", "named_entities": ["Intensive Care Units", "mortality", "electronic medical records", "outcome prediction"]}

original: original_corpus: 'Plasmodium vivax reemerged in the Republic of Korea (ROK) in 1993, and is likely to continue to affect public health. The purpose of this study was to measure levels of anti-P. vivax antibodies using indirect fluorescent antibody test (IFAT) in border areas of ROK, to determine the seroprevalence of malaria (2003-2005) and to plan effective control strategies. Blood samples of the inhabitants in Gimpo-si, Paju-si, and Yeoncheon-gun (Gyeonggi-do), and Cheorwon-gun (Gangwon-do) were collected and kept in Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC). Out of a total of 1,774 serum samples tested, the overall seropositivity was 0.94% (n=17). The seropositivity was the highest in Paju-si (1.9%, 7/372), followed by Gimpo-si (1.4%, 6/425), Yeoncheon-gun (0.67%, 3/451), and Cheorwon-gun (0.19%, 1/526). The annual parasite incidence (API) in these areas gradually decreased from 2003 to 2005 (1.69, 1.09, and 0.80 in 2003, 2004, and 2005, respectively). The highest API was found in Yeoncheon-gun, followed by Cheorwon-gun, Paju-si, and Gimpo-si. The API ranking in these areas did not change over the 3 years. The seropositivity of Gimpo-si showed a strong linear relationship with the API of 2005 (r=0.9983, P=0.036). Seropositivity data obtained using IFAT may be useful for understanding malaria prevalence of relevant years, predicting future transmission of malaria, and for establishing and evaluating malaria control programs in affected areas.'

Blood samples from individuals in Gimpo-si, Paju-si, and Yeoncheon-gun (Gyeonggi-do), as well as Cheorwon-gun (Gangwon-do), were gathered and stored at the Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC). The annual parasite incidence (API) across these regions showed a decreasing trend from 2003 to 2005 (1.69, 1.09, and 0.80, respectively), with the highest API reported in Yeoncheon-gun, then Cheorwon-gun, Paju-si, and Gimpo-si. The API rankings remained consistent over the three-year period. Notably, a strong linear correlation was identified between the seropositivity in Gimpo-si and the API of 2005 (r=0.9983, P=0.036). The findings from the IFAT seropositivity rates offer insights into the malaria situation during the studied years, can help in forecasting future malaria transmissions, and are valuable for the development and assessment of malaria control initiatives in the regions studied.", "named_entities": ["Plasmodium vivax", "Republic of Korea (ROK)", "indirect fluorescent antibody test (IFAT)", "Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC)", "seropositivity", "annual parasite incidence (API)"]}

original: original_corpus: 'Captive adult common marmosets (Callithrix jacchus) produce whistle-like "phee" calls in two contexts; in the home cage environment, phee calls may function as part of territorial marking behavior, and when animals are separated from social companions, phee calls may serve to reunite the group. Isolation phee calls tend to have more syllables than calls produced in the home cage by the same animals, and as a result, are longer in duration. The durations of isolation call syllables are shorter than in home cage calls, and isolation calls have lower start and end frequencies, higher peak frequencies, and increased frequency range compared to phee calls produced by the same animals in their home cages. The modifications made to the general structure of the phee call by isolated animals result in more information that may indicate context or location of an isolated caller. When the vocalizations were analyzed by sex, between-sex differences in call structure appeared consistently in both contexts. Males tended to exhibit higher call frequencies and greater variability between syllables than females. Published 1993 Wiley-Liss, Inc.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "In captivity, adult common marmosets (Callithrix jacchus) emit a whistle-like sound known as the \"phee\" call under two distinct situations; within the confines of their home cage, these calls likely play a role in territorial demarcation, whereas in scenarios where individuals are separated from their group members, the phee call is thought to facilitate group reassembly. Phee calls made during isolation contain more syllables and are thus longer than those made in the home cage by the same marmosets. Moreover, the syllables of isolation calls are briefer than those in home cage calls, with isolation calls exhibiting lower initial and terminal frequencies, higher peak frequencies, and a broader frequency range when compared to home cage phee calls. These alterations in the phee call's structure by isolated marmosets may carry additional information useful for indicating the context or pinpointing the location of the caller. Upon examining the calls by gender, distinct structural differences were consistently noted across both scenarios. Males displayed calls with higher frequencies and more variability in syllables compared to females. Published in 1993 by Wiley-Liss, Inc.", "named_entities": ["common marmosets", "Callithrix jacchus", "phee", "territorial marking behavior", "isolation", "Wiley-Liss, Inc."]}

original: original_corpus: 'Chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) is one of the most common types of leukemia in the western world which affects mainly the elderly population. Progress of the disease is very heterogeneous both in terms of necessity of treatment and life expectancy. The current scoring system for prognostic evaluation of patients with CLL is called CLL-IPI and predicts the general progress of the disease but is not a measure or a decision aid for the necessity of treatment. Due to the heterogeneous behavior of CLL it is important to develop tools that will identify if and when patients will necessitate treatment for CLL. Recently, Machine Learning (ML) has spread to many public health fields including diagnosis and prognosis of diseases.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "Chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) stands as a prevalent leukemia variant in the western hemisphere, primarily targeting the older demographic. The progression of this disease varies widely, influencing both the timing and need for therapeutic intervention alongside patient survival rates. The CLL-IPI, a current prognostic scoring system, forecasts the overall trajectory of CLL but does not serve as a guide for treatment initiation. Given CLL's variable nature, there's a critical need for the development of mechanisms that can accurately determine the necessity and timing for CLL treatment. The infiltration of Machine Learning (ML) into numerous public health arenas, including disease diagnosis and prognosis, marks a significant advancement towards this goal.", "named_entities": ["Chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL)", "CLL-IPI", "Machine Learning (ML)"]}

original: original_corpus: 'White-footed mice (Peromyscus leucopus) serve as the principal reservoir for Borrelia burgdorferi and have been shown to remain infected for life. Complex infections with multiple genetic variants of B. burgdorferi occur in mice through multiple exposures to infected ticks or through exposure to ticks infected with multiple variants of B. burgdorferi. Using a combination of cloning and single strand conformation polymorphism (SSCP), B. burgdorferi ospC variation was assessed in serial samples collected from individual P. leucopus during a single transmission season. In individuals with ospC variation, at least seven ospC variants were recognized at each time point. One to four of these variants predominated at each time point; however, the predominant variants seldom remained consistent in an individual mouse throughout the entire sampling period. These results confirmed that mice in southern Maryland were persistently infected with multiple variants of B. burgdorferi throughout the transmission season. However, the presence of multiple ospC variants and the fluctuations in the frequency of these variants indicates that either new ospC variants are regularly introduced to this mouse population and predominate while the existing infections are cleared, or that the variation detected in the genetic profile at different time points reflects a complex mixture of B. burgdorferi populations whose relative frequencies may continually change.'

Research involving cloning and single strand conformation polymorphism (SSCP) techniques was conducted to examine changes in the B. burgdorferi ospC gene within individual P. leucopus mice over a single season of transmission. For those mice demonstrating ospC gene variation, up to seven distinct ospC variants were identified at each sampling interval. Typically, between one and four of these variants were more dominant at any given time, though the dominant strains rarely stayed the same in any one mouse throughout the study period. The discovery of numerous ospC variants and their shifting dominance suggests either the continual introduction of new ospC variants into the mouse population, which temporarily become prevalent as prior infections are eliminated, or that the detected genetic variations at different times signify a dynamic balance of B. burgdorferi populations that shifts in dominance.",
