original: original_corpus: 'Coronavirus disease 19 (COVID-19) is currently a global pandemic that affects patients with other pathologies. Here, we investigated the influence of treatments for osteoporosis and other non-inflammatory rheumatic conditions, such as osteoarthritis and fibromyalgia, on COVID-19 incidence. To this end, we conducted a cross-sectional study of 2,102 patients being treated at the Rheumatology Service of Hospital del Mar (Barcelona, Spain). In our cohort, COVID-19 cumulative incidence from March 1 to May 3, 2020 was compared to population estimates for the same city. We used Poisson regression models to determine the adjusted relative risk ratios for COVID-19 associated with different treatments and comorbidities. Denosumab, zoledronate and calcium were negatively associated with COVID-19 incidence. Some analgesics, particularly pregabalin and most of the studied antidepressants, were positively associated with COVID-19 incidence, whereas duloxetine presented a negative association. Oral bisphosphonates, vitamin D, thiazide diuretics, anti-hypertensive drugs and chronic non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs had no effect on COVID-19 incidence in the studied population. Our results provide novel evidence to support the maintenance of the main anti-osteoporosis treatments in COVID-19 patients, which may be of particular relevance to elderly patients affected by the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic.'

original_corpus: 'Alcohol consumption is one of the strongest predictors of suboptimal adherence to antiretroviral therapy (ART), however, there is little research that has investigated both within- and between-person associations of alcohol consumption and ART adherence at the event-level. In this secondary data-analysis, (Nâ€‰=â€‰22) HIV-positive MSM prospectively reported daily alcohol consumption and ART adherence for 42-days. Multilevel models demonstrated (1) days in which participants reported consuming any alcohol was associated with 2.48 increased odds of ART non-adherence, compared to days in which participants reported no alcohol consumption, and (2) there was a non-significant trend indicating days in which participants reported consuming greater than their own average levels of alcohol was associated with increased odds of ART non-adherence. Findings highlight the importance of combining intervention efforts that address alcohol consumption and suboptimal ART adherence, and indicate a need for future research to investigate the mechanisms by which alcohol influences ART adherence.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "Alcohol intake has been identified as a major factor affecting poor adherence to antiretroviral therapy (ART), yet studies exploring the direct and indirect effects of alcohol use on ART adherence at the specific instance level are scarce. In a secondary analysis of data, (N = 22) HIV-positive men who have sex with men (MSM) provided daily reports of their alcohol use and adherence to ART over a period of 42 days. Using multilevel modeling, the analysis revealed that (1) on days when participants drank any amount of alcohol, they were 2.48 times more likely to not adhere to their ART regimen compared to days they did not drink, and (2) there was an observed, though not statistically significant, tendency that on days participants drank more than their usual amount, the likelihood of not sticking to their ART regimen increased. These outcomes underscore the necessity of integrating strategies that target both alcohol consumption and ART adherence improvement. They also point to the urgent need for further investigations into how alcohol affects ART adherence.", "named_entities": ["Alcohol consumption", "antiretroviral therapy", "ART non-adherence", "multilevel models", "HIV-positive MSM"]}

original: original_corpus: 'Total knee arthroplasty (TKA) is an effective procedure for relieving pain and restoring function in osteoarthritis, with a significant proportion of patients having severe disease bilaterally. However, although there are differences in patient selection criteria for bilateral procedures, there is no consensus regarding the optimal timing for bilateral TKA. The aim of this study was to compare rates and causes of revision and 30-day mortality between simultaneous and staged bilateral TKA using data from the Australian Orthopaedic Association National Joint Replacement Registry.'

original_corpus: 'We used fMRI to investigate the effects of tactile co-activation on the topographic organization of the human primary somatosensory cortex (SI). Behavioral consequences of co-activation were studied in a psychophysical task assessing the mislocalization of tactile stimuli. Co-activation was applied to the index, middle and ring fingers of the right hand either synchronously or asynchronously. Cortical representations for synchronously co-activated fingers moved closer together, whereas cortical representations for asynchronously co-activated fingers became segregated. Behaviorally, this pattern coincided with an increased and reduced number of mislocalizations between synchronously and asynchronously co-activated fingers, respectively. Thus, both synchronous and asynchronous coupling of passive tactile stimulation is able to induce short-term cortical reorganization associated with functionally relevant changes.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging (fMRI) was utilized to explore how tactile co-activation influences the spatial layout of the human primary somatosensory cortex (SI). The behavioral effects of this co-activation were examined through a psychophysical task that measured the incorrect placement of tactile sensations. Co-activation involved simultaneously or sequentially stimulating the index, middle, and ring fingers of the right hand. For fingers that were stimulated at the same time, their cortical representations moved closer to each other, while the cortical representations for fingers stimulated at different times became more distinct from one another. From a behavioral perspective, there was a noticeable increase in the misidentification of the location of tactile stimuli between fingers stimulated synchronously, and a decrease among those stimulated asynchronously. original: original_corpus: 'Disulfide-bond formation, mediated by the Dsb family of proteins, is important in the correct folding of secreted or extracellular proteins in bacteria. In Gram-negative bacteria, disulfide bonds are introduced into the folding proteins in the periplasm by DsbA. DsbE from Escherichia coli has been implicated in the reduction of disulfide bonds in the maturation of cytochrome c. The Gram-positive bacterium Mycobacterium tuberculosis encodes DsbE and its homologue DsbF, the structures of which have been determined. However, the two mycobacterial proteins are able to oxidatively fold a protein in vitro, unlike DsbE from E. coli. In this study, the crystal structure of a DsbE or DsbF homologue protein from Corynebacterium diphtheriae has been determined, which revealed a thioredoxin-like domain with a typical CXXC active site. Structural comparison with M. tuberculosis DsbF would help in understanding the function of the C. diphtheriae protein.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "The formation of disulfide bonds, facilitated by the Dsb protein family, plays a crucial role in the proper folding of proteins that are secreted or reside outside the cell in bacteria. In Gram-negative bacteria, proteins folding in the periplasm are introduced to disulfide bonds by DsbA. DsbE, found in Escherichia coli, is known for its role in reducing disulfide bonds during the maturation of cytochrome c. Conversely, the Gram-positive Mycobacterium tuberculosis produces DsbE and its similar protein DsbF, both of which have had their structures identified. Unlike DsbE from E. coli, these mycobacterial proteins can oxidatively fold a protein in a test tube. This research also includes the crystal structure analysis of a protein homologous to DsbE or DsbF from Corynebacterium diphtheriae, showing a thioredoxin-like domain and a classic CXXC active site. A structural comparison with M. tuberculosis DsbF can provide insights into the functionality of the C. diphtheriae protein.", "named_entities": ["Dsb family", "DsbA", "DsbE", "Escherichia coli", "cytochrome c", "Mycobacterium tuberculosis", "DsbF", "Corynebacterium diphtheriae", "CXXC active site"]}

original: original_corpus: 'Hepatocellular carcinoma is one of the fastest growing cancers in the US and has a low survival rate, partly due to difficulties in early detection. Because of HCC's high heterogeneity, it has been suggested that multiple biomarkers would be needed to develop a sensitive HCC screening test. This study applied random forest (RF), a machine learning technique, and proposed two novel models, fixed sequential (FS) and two-step (TS), for comparison with two commonly used statistical techniques, logistic regression (LR) and classification and regression trees (CART), in combining multiple urine DNA biomarkers for HCC screening using biomarker values obtained from 137 HCC and 431 non-HCC (224 hepatitis and 207 cirrhosis) subjects. The sensitivity, specificity, area under the receiver operating curve, and variability were estimated through repeated 10-fold cross-validation to compare the models' performances in accuracy and robustness. We show that RF and TS have higher accuracy and stability; specifically, they reach 90% specificity and 86%/87% sensitivity respectively along with 15% higher sensitivity and 10% higher specificity than LR in cross-validation. The potential of RF and TS to develop a panel of multiple biomarkers and the possibility for self-training, cloud-based models for HCC screening are discussed.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "Hepatocellular carcinoma, a rapidly expanding cancer type in the US with a low survival rate, faces early detection challenges due to its high heterogeneity. It has been proposed that a sensitive screening test for HCC would require the use of several biomarkers. In this research, the machine learning approach known as random forest (RF) was employed, alongside the introduction of two innovative models, fixed sequential (FS) and two-step (TS), to be evaluated against the traditional statistical methods of logistic regression (LR) and classification and regression trees (CART). This evaluation involved combining multiple urine DNA biomarkers for HCC screening, with biomarker data gathered from 137 individuals with HCC and 431 without (comprising 224 with hepatitis and 207 with cirrhosis). The models were compared based on their performance metrics including sensitivity, specificity, the area under the receiver operating curve, and variability, assessed through repeated 10-fold cross-validation. The findings revealed that RF and TS models demonstrated superior accuracy and consistency, achieving 90% specificity and 86%/87% sensitivity, and exhibited 15% greater sensitivity and 10% higher specificity than LR in cross-validation. The study also explores the potential of RF and TS models for developing a comprehensive panel of biomarkers and the prospects for self-learning, cloud-based models in HCC screening.", "named_entities": ["Hepatocellular carcinoma", "HCC", "random forest", "RF", "fixed sequential", "FS", "two-step", "TS", "logistic regression", "LR", "classification and regression trees", "CART"]}

original: original_corpus: 'Caulobacter crescentus (CB15) initiates chromosome replication only in stalked cells and not in swarmers. To better understand this dimorphic control of chromosome replication, we isolated replication origins (oris) from freshwater Caulobacter (FWC) and marine Caulobacter (MCS) species. Previous studies implicated integration host factor (IHF) and CcrM DNA methylation sites in replication control. However, ori IHF and CcrM sites identified in the model FWC CB15 were only conserved among closely related FWCs. DnaA boxes and CtrA binding sites are established CB15 ori components. CtrA is a two-component regulator that blocks chromosome replication selectively in CB15 swarmers. DnaA boxes and CtrA sites were found in five FWC and three MCS oris. Usually, a DnaA box and a CtrA site were paired, suggesting that CtrA binding regulates DnaA activity. We tested this hypothesis by site-directed mutagenesis of an MCS10 ori which contains only one CtrA binding site overlapping a critical DnaA box. This overlapping site is unique in the whole MCS10 genome. Selective DnaA box mutations decreased replication, while selective CtrA binding site mutations increased replication of MCS10 ori plasmids. Therefore, both FWC and MCS oris use CtrA to repress replication. Despite this similarity, phylogenetic analysis unexpectedly shows that CtrA usage evolved separately among these Caulobacter oris. We discuss consensus oris and convergent ori evolution in differentiating bacteria.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "Caulobacter crescentus (CB15) begins its chromosome replication process exclusively in stalked cells rather than in swarming cells. To deepen our understanding of how chromosome replication is differently controlled in these cell forms, we extracted replication origins (oris) from both freshwater Caulobacter (FWC) and marine Caulobacter (MCS) strains. Prior research has highlighted the role of integration host factor (IHF) and CcrM DNA methylation sites in governing replication. Yet, the ori IHF and CcrM sites found in the FWC CB15 model showed consistency only within closely related freshwater strains. Components such as DnaA boxes and CtrA binding sites are critical to CB15 ori function. CtrA, a regulatory protein, specifically inhibits chromosome replication in swarmer cells of CB15. Analysis identified DnaA boxes and CtrA binding sites across five FWC and three MCS oris, often paired together, indicating that CtrA's interaction with these sites might control DnaA's activity. To explore this theory, we conducted targeted mutagenesis on an MCS10 ori, which uniquely possesses a CtrA site overlapping an essential DnaA box. Alterations to the DnaA box reduced replication, whereas mutations to the CtrA site enhanced replication in MCS10 ori plasmids, showing that both FWC and MCS oris rely on CtrA for replication repression. Despite these parallels, a phylogenetic examination revealed that the use of CtrA in regulating oris evolved independently among Caulobacter strains, leading to a discussion on the shared replication origins and the independent evolution of replication control mechanisms among diverse bacteria.", "named_entities": ["Caulobacter crescentus", "stalked cells", "swarmers", "replication origins", "freshwater Caulobacter", "marine Caulobacter", "integration host factor", "IHF", "CcrM DNA methylation", "DnaA boxes", "CtrA binding sites", "site-directed mutagenesis", "MCS10"]}

original: original_corpus: 'The physiological benefits of dietary flavonoids have been attributed to their antioxidant and signaling properties. Our previous study revealed that hesperetin exhibits neuroprotection in PC12 cells by diverse mechanisms. Biological activities of flavonoids might be determined by their chemical structures. Here, we further studied the effects of hesperetin and its structural counterparts, isorhamnetin and isosakuranetin, on kinases related to survival signaling as well as other cytoprotective actions. Pretreatment with flavonoids (0.8 or 50 microM) increased cell viability and catalase activity (CA) and decreased membrane damage, reactive oxygen species (ROS) generation, intracellular calcium level ([Ca2+]i), and caspase-3 activity in H2O2-treated PC12 cells. Increased CA, [Ca2+]i, and ROS levels, but lower caspase-3 activities, were obtained upon treatment with 50 microM isorhamnetin or isosakuranetin. Based on their structural differences and the concentrations used, these flavonoids differentially activated pro-survival signaling molecules, including Akt/protein kinase B, p38 mitogen-activated protein kinase, and inhibited the activation of c-jun N-terminal kinase, which triggers apoptosis. Our results demonstrate that signaling actions of thses flavonoids are involved in their neuroprotection against oxidative stress and that they act more as signaling molecules than antioxidants.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "The health advantages of dietary flavonoids are often linked to their antioxidant capabilities and their role in cell signaling. Previous research indicated that hesperetin could protect nerve cells in PC12 cultures through various pathways. The effectiveness of flavonoids like hesperetin may depend on their molecular structure. In continued research, the impact of hesperetin and related compounds, isorhamnetin and isosakuranetin, was assessed concerning their ability to activate survival signaling kinases and other defensive mechanisms. Applying these flavonoids before treatment (at concentrations of 0.8 or 50 micrometers) enhanced cell survival, increased catalase enzyme activity, and reduced cell membrane damage, production of reactive oxygen species, levels of internal calcium ([Ca2+]i), and the activity of caspase-3 in cells treated with H2O2. original: original_corpus: 'Long non-coding RNAs (lncRNAs) are transcripts longer than 200 nt that are involved in cardiovascular diseases (CVDs). To determine whether lncRNAs are involved in stable angina pectoris (SAP), we analysed the expression profile of lncRNAs and mRNAs on a genome-wide scale in SAP of Uyghur population. Five pairs of SAP patients and healthy controls were screened by an Agilent microarray (human lncRNA + mRNA Array V4.0). Quantitative real-time polymerase chain reaction (qRT-PCR) was used to validate the lncRNA expression levels in 50 SAP and 50 controls. Data analyses were performed using R and Bioconductor. A total of 1871 up- and 231 down-regulated lncRNAs were identified to be differentially expressed in the peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs). Microarray analysis results identified the lncRNAs NR_037652.1, ENST00000607654.1, ENST00000589524.1 and uc004bhb.3, which were confirmed by qRT-PCR. Among screened lncRNAs, the annotation result of their co-expressed mRNAs showed that the most significantly related pathways were the NF-ÎºB signalling pathway, apoptosis and the p53 signalling pathway, while the main significantly related diseases were the cholesterol, calcium and coronary disease. Our study indicated that clusters of lncRNAs were significantly differentially expressed between SAP patients and matched controls. These lncRNAs may play a significant role in SAP development and could serve as biomarkers and potential targets for the future treatment of SAP.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "Transcripts longer than 200 nucleotides, known as long non-coding RNAs (lncRNAs), have a role in cardiovascular diseases (CVDs). This study explored the involvement of lncRNAs in stable angina pectoris (SAP) by analyzing both lncRNA and mRNA expression profiles at a genome-wide level in the Uyghur population. A comparative analysis between five pairs of SAP patients and healthy individuals was conducted using an Agilent microarray (human lncRNA + mRNA Array V4.0). To confirm the levels of lncRNA expression, quantitative real-time polymerase chain reaction (qRT-PCR) was utilized on samples from 50 SAP patients and 50 healthy controls. The analysis utilized R and Bioconductor for data processing. In the peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs), 1871 lncRNAs were found to be up-regulated and 231 were down-regulated, indicating differential expression. The microarray analysis pinpointed specific lncRNAs, including NR_037652.1, ENST00000607654.1, ENST00000589524.1, and uc004bhb.3, which were further validated by qRT-PCR. The investigation into the co-expressed mRNAs of these lncRNAs revealed their significant association with pathways such as NF-ÎºB signaling, apoptosis, and the p53 signaling pathway. Additionally, these pathways were linked to diseases like cholesterol imbalance, calcium disorders, and coronary disease. The study concludes that certain lncRNas are markedly over or under-expressed in SAP patients compared to healthy controls, suggesting their crucial role in the onset of SAP. These lncRNAs could be crucial for identifying biomarkers and developing new treatments for SAP.", "named_entities": ["long non-coding RNAs (lncRNAs)", "cardiovascular diseases (CVDs)", "stable angina pectoris (SAP)", "Agilent microarray", "quantitative real-time polymerase chain reaction (qRT-PCR)", "peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs)", "NF-ÎºB signalling pathway", "apoptosis", "p53 signalling pathway"]}

original: original_corpus: 'The effect of prior urinary tract obstruction on total CO2 flux in cortical and medullary collecting tubules was examined using an unilateral ureteral obstruction model and isolated tubule in vitro microperfusion. Tubules were obtained from the control and obstructed kidneys after 1, 2, and 4 days of obstruction. Paired comparison of function of cortical or medullary tubules and urine pH was made. Medullary collecting tubules showed decreased acidification after 2 days of obstruction (7.7 +/- 8.5 vs. 29.9 +/- 6.6 pmol/mm/min). Cortical collecting tubules from the obstructed kidney showed high rates of acidification at all time periods examined, and rates from the postobstructed cortical collecting tubules exceeded levels from control tubules at the 24-hour period while barely missing significance (p less than 0.06) at the 48- and 96-hour periods. These data are not consistent with the hypothesis that the acidification defect in the postobstructed kidney occurs in the cortical collecting tubule by a voltage-dependent mechanism.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "The impact of previous urinary tract blockages on the total CO2 transfer within the cortical and medullary collecting ducts was investigated using a model of unilateral ureteral obstruction and in vitro isolated tubule microperfusion. Tubules were collected from kidneys both unaffected and blocked after obstruction periods of 1, 2, and 4 days. A direct comparison was conducted between the functions of cortical or medullary tubules and urine acidity. It was observed that the medullary collecting tubules exhibited a reduction in their ability to acidify after two days of blockage (7.7 +/- 8.5 vs. 29.9 +/- 6.6 pmol/mm/min). Conversely, cortical collecting tubules from kidneys that were obstructed demonstrated persistent high acidification rates at all measured intervals, with acidification rates of post-obstructed cortical tubules surpassing those of the control tubules at the 24-hour mark and closely approaching statistical significance (p less than 0.06) at the 48- and 96-hour marks. These findings challenge the theory that the acidification impairment observed in kidneys after obstruction is due to a voltage-dependent mechanism within the cortical collecting tubule.", "named_entities": ["urinary tract obstruction", "CO2 flux", "cortical", "medullary collecting tubules", "unilateral ureteral obstruction", "in vitro", "microperfusion", "acidification"]}

original: original_corpus: 'Irregular (nonsigmoidal) ionization behavior of titratable groups in proteins is analyzed theoretically, using a computational algorithm designed to count explicitly for tautomers of titratable groups and different locations of polar hydrogens. On the basis of calculations for different model systems (acid-acid, base-base, acid-base pairs, and cluster of three strongly interacting groups), it is demonstrated that the pK values, extracted from nonsigmoidal titration curves by fitting to a sum of Henderson-Hasselbalch equations, do not describe the ionization equilibrium correctly. The conditions for observation of irregular titration curves are derived analytically for the case of arbitrary couple of interacting ionizable groups. A possible relation between irregularly shaped titration curves and tautomerization is also illustrated. The protonation-deprotonation equilibrium of Asp76 in ribonuclease T1 is shown to be coupled to dipole reorientation of a water molecule bound at the protein-solvent interface. This finding provides a new interpretation of the experimentally observed chemical shift of this residue.'
output:
{
  "paraphrase_corpus": "The study examines the irregular (non-linear) ionization patterns of titratable groups in proteins through a theoretical lens, employing a computational algorithm that specifically accounts for tautomers of these groups and the variance in polar hydrogen locations. Through calculations conducted on various model systems, including acid-acid, base-base, and acid-base pairings, as well as a cluster of three closely interacting groups, it is shown that pK values derived from non-linear titration curves using a series of Henderson-Hasselbalch equations fail to accurately represent the ionization equilibrium. Analytical conditions under which these irregular titration curves become observable are established for any given pair of interacting ionizable groups. Furthermore, a potential connection between the peculiar shapes of titration curves and tautomerization processes is highlighted. The research also reveals that the protonation and deprotonation balance of Asp76 in ribonuclease T1 is interconnected with the reorientation of a water molecule's dipole at the boundary of the protein and solvent. This insight offers an alternative explanation for the chemically shifted signals observed for this residue in experiments.",

original: original_corpus: 'This meta-analysis aimed to compare the long-term prognosis of patients with colorectal liver metastases undergoing liver resection (LR) with or without radiofrequency ablation (RFA). A systematic search was performed using both medical subject headings and truncated word searches to identify all comparative studies published on this topic. The primary outcomes were postoperative overall survival (OS) and disease-free survival (DFS). Pooled hazard ratios (HR) with 95 per cent confidence intervals (95% CI) were calculated. A total of 10 studies which included 3900 patients were finally enrolled in the meta-analysis. Patients treated by LR gained better OS (HR: 2.07, 95% CI: 1.82-2.37) and DFS (HR: 1.91, 95% CI: 1.70-2.15) than those patients treated by LR + RFA, after pooling unadjusted HRs from the 10 studies. Five studies provided the data of adjusted HR. The pooled results showed that patients in the LR + RFA group had shorter OS (HR: 1.66, 95% CI: 1.18-2.32, P = 0.004) but similar DFS (HR: 1.36, 95% CI: 0.99-1.88) compared with patients in the LR group. Our meta-analysis showed that colorectal liver metastases patients who underwent LR gained better long-term outcomes compared with patients undergoing LR + RFA. However, after adjusting confounders, LR + RFA achieved comparable DFS with LR alone.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "This meta-analysis was conducted to evaluate and compare the long-term survival outcomes of colorectal cancer patients with liver metastases who underwent liver resection (LR) alone versus those who had LR combined with radiofrequency ablation (RFA). A comprehensive search was carried out using medical subject headings and keyword searches to gather all relevant comparative studies on the subject. The main endpoints analyzed were overall survival (OS) and disease-free survival (DFS) post-surgery. Hazard ratios (HR) along with 95 percent confidence intervals (95% CI) were computed for the pooled data. In total, 10 studies encompassing 3900 patients were included in the analysis. The findings indicated that patients treated solely with LR exhibited improved OS (HR: 2.07, 95% CI: 1.82-2.37) and DFS (HR: 1.91, 95% CI: 1.70-2.15) compared to those who received LR in conjunction with RFA, based on unadjusted HRs from the studies. Out of these, five studies provided adjusted HR data, revealing that the combined treatment group (LR + RFA) had a shorter OS (HR: 1.66, 95% CI: 1.18-2.32, P = 0.004) but similar DFS (HR: 1.36, 95% CI: 0.99-1.88) as the LR-only group. The meta-analysis concluded that patients with colorectal liver metastases who had LR alone experienced better long-term outcomes than those undergoing combined LR + RFA. Nonetheless, after adjustment for confounding factors, LR + RFA was found to provide comparable DFS to LR alone.", "named_entities": ["colorectal liver metastases", "liver resection (LR)", "radiofrequency ablation (RFA)", "overall survival (OS)", "disease-free survival (DFS)", "hazard ratios (HR)", "95 per cent confidence intervals (95% CI)"]}

original: original_corpus: 'Over the years, the definition of implant failure has varied, with some investigators accounting for all implants placed, while others discard failures that occurred before clinical loading. The influence of stresses transmitted to various bone densities, by different prosthetic appliances as well as the method used to determine failures, needs to be clearly understood. This paper reports on the influence of two different methods of determining 36-month survival of implants used to support different dental prostheses.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus":"Throughout time, the concept of implant failure has seen various interpretations, with certain researchers considering every implant inserted, whereas some exclude failures that happen prior to the clinical application of load. It's essential to grasp the impact of stress distribution to different bone densities by various dental devices, along with how failure determination methods affect the outcomes. This study discusses how two distinct approaches to calculating the 36-month success rate of implants, supporting various dental prosthetics, influence their perceived durability.","named_entities":["implant failure","clinical loading","prosthetic appliances","36-month survival","dental prostheses"]}

original: original_corpus: 'By using inverse PCR and DNA sequencing, 13 sul3-associated mutational integrons, 2 defective class 1 integrons, and 1 qnrB2-associated complex sul1-type class 1 integrons were identified in Salmonella enterica serovar Choleraesuis, Pseudomonas aeruginosa, and Enterobacter cloacae, respectively. In addition, conjugation and Southern hybridization demonstrated that unusual class 1 integrons were located on plasmids or integrated into chromosomal DNA. Thus, an inverse PCR assay can be a valuable tool for the analysis of unusual structures of the 3' conserved region of class 1 integrons.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "Through the application of inverse PCR and DNA sequencing, researchers discovered 13 sul3-linked mutational integrons, two non-functional class 1 integrons, and one qnrB2-linked complex sul1-type class 1 integron in Salmonella enterica serovar Choleraesuis, Pseudomonas aeruginosa, and Enterobacter cloacae, respectively. Furthermore, the use of conjugation and Southern hybridization techniques showed that these atypical class 1 integrons were either present on plasmids or had become part of the chromosomal DNA. Hence, the inverse PCR assay emerges as a useful method for investigating the unique configurations of the 3' conserved segment of class 1 integrons.", "named_entities": ["inverse PCR", "DNA sequencing", "sul3-associated mutational integrons", "class 1 integrons", "qnrB2-associated complex sul1-type class 1 integrons", "Salmonella enterica serovar Choleraesuis", "Pseudomonas aeruginosa", "Enterobacter cloacae", "conjugation", "Southern hybridization", "plasmids", "chromosomal DNA"]}

original: original_corpus: 'Polygonum multiflorum Thunb. has been used widely in East Asia in treatment of diseases associated with aging. However, there are many reports referred to the toxicity of P. multiflorum, especially for liver adverse reactions. The toxicity of it is caused by over dosage or by the herb itself remains unclear. The aim of this study was to study the toxicity of different extractions, components and constituents of P. multiflorum, which were assessed in zebrafish embryos. Firstly, the difference of extracting solvent to the toxicity of P. multiflorum was researched to probe the influence of usages to the safety of P. multiflorum. The toxicity of 70% EtOH extract is considerably higher than that of other extracts. Secondly, 70% EtOH extract was subjected to macroporous resin (DM-8) eluting with a gradient of water and EtOH (H<sub>2</sub>O, 25% EtOH, 40% EtOH and 95% EtOH) to give four components (A-D). The toxicity of the component (D) showed higher than the other components (A-C). Thus, the component (D) was taken more attentions to research. Lastly, study on the chemical constituents of the component (D), 27 compounds, including 7 anthraquinones (1-7), 8 stilbenes (8-15), 7 anthrones (16-22), 3 cinnamic acid amides (23-25), 2 naphthols (26-27) were isolated and assessed in zebrafish embryos. Compounds 1-3, 16-22 and 26-27 showed severe toxicity against the zebrafish embryos while other compounds, such as stilbenes, showed no obvious toxicity.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "Polygonum multiflorum Thunb. is extensively used in East Asia for treating aging-related diseases. Nonetheless, concerns regarding its liver toxicity have been raised, with ambiguity surrounding whether the toxicity is due to overdosage or inherent properties of the herb. This study aimed to evaluate the toxicity of various extracts, components, and constituents of P. multiflorum using zebrafish embryos as a test model. Initially, the study investigated how the choice of solvent for extraction affects P. multiflorum's safety, discovering that the 70% ethanol (EtOH) extract exhibited significantly higher toxicity compared to other extracts. Further, the 70% EtOH extract was divided using DM-8 macroporous resin into four fractions (A-D) with varying ethanol-water ratios. Among these, the toxicity of component D was notably higher than the others, prompting detailed investigation. Analysis of component D's chemical makeup revealed 27 compounds, including anthraquinones, stilbenes, anthrones, cinnamic acid amides, and naphthols. In toxicity assessments on zebrafish embryos, specific compounds, notably some anthraquinones, anthrones, and naphthols, demonstrated high toxicity, whereas stilbene compounds were found to be comparatively non-toxic.", "named_entities": ["Polygonum multiflorum Thunb.", "liver toxicity", "zebrafish embryos", "70% EtOH extract", "DM-8 macroporous resin", "anthraquinones", "stilbenes", "anthrones", "cinnamic acid amides", "naphthols"]}

original: original_corpus: 'Label="BACKGROUND" NlmCategory="BACKGROUND">Diabetes mellitus (DM) is a prime risk factor for cardiovascular disease. The convincing experimental and clinical evidence indicated that the onset of DM is closely associated with oxidative stress and that the generation of reactive oxygen species increases in both the types of diabetes. The aim of the present study was to evaluate the effect of Teucrium polium (TP) hydroalcoholic extract on the blood glucose, cholesterol, triglyceride, and oxidative stress markers of the heart and aorta in streptozotocin (STZ)-induced diabetic rats.'

original_corpus: 'The reactivity of IgG and IgE antibodies from egg allergy patients to ovomucoid and its domain fragments was examined quantitatively, and compared with that of rabbit and mouse IgG anti-ovomucoid antibodies. The human antibodies reacted with the carbohydrate-containing domain fragments more strongly than the animal antibodies. In contrast, the human antibodies did not react with the carbohydrate-free third domain, whereas the animal antibodies definitely reacted. These results suggested that the sites and structures recognized by allergic individuals as ovomucoid antigenic determinants are not necessarily the same as those recognized by laboratory animals.'

It was found that the antibodies from humans had a stronger reaction to the segments of ovomucoid that contain carbohydrates than those from the animals. However, the human antibodies showed no reaction to the carbohydrate-lacking third domain of ovomucoid, unlike the animal antibodies which did react. These findings imply that the specific sites and structures identified as antigenic determinants of ovomucoid by allergic humans may differ from those recognized by laboratory animals.", "named_entities": ["IgG", "IgE", "egg allergy patients", "ovomucoid", "carbohydrate-containing domain fragments", "antigenic determinants"]}

original: original_corpus: 'Two hundred and sixty three patients with a diagnosis of brucellosis between January 1984 and December 1987 were studied prospectively. Sixty five patients (25%) developed osteoarticular complications. These patients had a more prolonged course than those with no complications. Spondylitis in 38 (58%) and sacroiliitis in 29 (45%) were the most prevalent. There were no significant laboratory, serological, or bacteriological differences between patients with and without osteoarticular complications. At diagnosis 47 patients (72%) showed radiographic abnormalities, commonly in axial sites but rarely in peripheral sites. Radionuclide bone scan was positive with no radiographic abnormalities in 17 (26%) of cases. Fifty seven patients received medical treatment alone, 51 (89%) being cured with a single course of treatment. Treatment failed or there was a relapse in six patients (11%), of whom five had spondylitis. Eight of the 65 patients (12%), all of whom had spondylitis and paravertebral or epidural abscesses, also required surgical treatment.'

This study evaluated two hemoglobin tests, ABAcard(Â®) HemaTrace(Â®) and HemDirect Hemoglobin against glycophorin A test-RSIDâ„¢-Blood for following parameters: sensitivity, specificity, effectiveness using various substrates, stain remover and aged blood stains. No false positives were obtained for HemDirect Hemoglobin while ABAcard(Â®) HemaTrace(Â®), probably due to its extreme sensitivity, showed high percent of false positives with saliva. The lowest sensitivity and 40% of false positives with saliva was exhibited by RSIDâ„¢-Blood. In addition, this test encountered the lowest efficacy if aged blood-stains or blood treated with stain remover were used. As expected, none of the tested substrates (wood, metal, brick, and soil), influenced on blood testing, although soil substrate affected STR amplification. Conducted studies established HemDirect Hemoglobin test as more reliable for evaluated parameters than ABAcard(Â®) HemaTrace(Â®) and RSIDâ„¢-Blood.'

original: original_corpus: 'Nonalcoholic fatty liver disease is the most common noninfectious liver disease in clinical practice, and there is an increasing need for new therapeutic approaches for the treatment of this liver disease. Here, we examined the effect of the thyroid hormone triiodothyronine (T3) and the agonist of the thyroid hormone receptor beta isoform (TRbeta), GC-1, on fatty liver and steatohepatitis induced in rodents by a choline-methionine deficient (CMD) diet. Male Fischer 344 rats fed a CMD diet for 1 wk developed a marked fatty liver and mild hepatitis. Concurrent administration of T3 resulted in a complete prevention of the fatty change associated with increased fatty acid mitochondrial and peroxisomal beta-oxidation. To investigate whether T3 could also reverse fully established fatty liver, rats were fed a CMD diet for 10 wk and then cofed T3 for 1 wk. Coadministration of T3 resulted in a complete regression of liver steatosis associated with a decrease of lipid peroxidation, cyclooxygenase-2 expression, and activation of phospho-STAT3 and phospho-SAPK/JNK. Finally, additional experiments showed that GC-1, which has no significant side effects on heart rate, prevented and reverted CMD-induced fat accumulation, and ameliorated steatohepatitis. These results indicate that TR agonists have the potential to inhibit or reverse hepatic steatosis induced by a nutritional model.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "Nonalcoholic fatty liver disease stands as the most prevalent noninfectious liver condition encountered in medical settings, prompting a growing demand for innovative treatment methods. In our study, we assessed the impacts of the thyroid hormone triiodothyronine (T3) and a specific agonist for the thyroid hormone receptor beta variant (TRbeta), known as GC-1, on fatty liver and steatohepatitis triggered in rodents through a diet deficient in choline and methionine (CMD). Male Fischer 344 rats subjected to a CMD diet for one week exhibited significant fat accumulation in the liver and slight hepatitis. The simultaneous treatment with T3 effectively prevented the fat buildup, enhancing fatty acid breakdown in mitochondria and peroxisomes through beta-oxidation. Further experiments explored the ability of T3 to reverse already established fatty liver conditions by administering T3 to rats after feeding them a CMD diet for 10 weeks. This co-treatment with T3 led to a full reversal of liver fat accumulation, noted by reduced lipid peroxidation, downregulation of cyclooxygenase-2 expression, and the activation of phospho-STAT3 and phospho-SAPK/JNK. Moreover, subsequent research revealed that GC-1 also countered and reversed CMD diet-induced fat accumulation and improved steatohepatitis without adversely affecting heart rate. These findings suggest that agonists of the TR receptor might offer a viable strategy to either prevent or mitigate hepatic steatosis caused by dietary factors.", "named_entities": ["Nonalcoholic fatty liver disease", "triiodothyronine (T3)", "thyroid hormone receptor beta isoform (TRbeta)", "GC-1", "choline-methionine deficient (CMD) diet", "mitochondrial and peroxisomal beta-oxidation", "cyclooxygenase-2", "phospho-STAT3", "phospho-SAPK/JNK"]}

original: original_corpus: 'Explicit memory and two forms of implicit memory, repetition priming and cognitive skill learning, were examined in twenty-four schizophrenic patients and twenty-four normal control subjects previously matched for sex, age, and educational level. Two explicit tasks, free recall and frequency monitoring, and two implicit tasks, word completion and the Tower of Toronto puzzle, a variant of the Tower of Hanoi puzzle, were selected. The performance of schizophrenic patients was impaired in both explicit tasks, whereas repetition priming was intact; in the Tower of Toronto puzzle, a deficit was observed in problem solving, but not in skill learning. This dissociation between explicit and implicit memory is not entirely consistent with the hypothesis of a deficiency in effort-demanding information processing. It could be better accommodated by a model of a disturbance in the internal representation of context.'

original_corpus: 'Three groups of ovariectomized rats were treated for 6 days: 1) estradiol benzoate (100 micrograms/kg) (SC) and fed ad lib; 2) vehicle-injected controls fed the same amount of food as eaten by estradiol-treated rats; 3) vehicle-injected, free-feeding controls. Specific binding of insulin to liver and hypothalamus slices was measured by quantitative film autoradiography. Estradiol-treated rats lost weight (p < 0.001) and had elevated plasma insulin (p < 0.01). Liver insulin binding in rats with estradiol treatment was greater (p < 0.01) than in rats without estradiol, but was less (p < 0.05) than in controls fed the same food levels as consumed by the estradiol-treated rats. Therefore, with equal food intake, estradiol decreased liver insulin binding. Insulin binding in the dorsomedial, ventromedial, and arcuate nuclei of the hypothalamus was unchanged by food intake or estradiol, however. Thus, altered insulin binding in the arcuate, ventromedial, or dorsomedial nuclei of the hypothalamus is probably not involved in the effects of insulin or estradiol on food intake.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "Three sets of rats without ovaries were subjected to a 6-day treatment: 1) given estradiol benzoate (100 micrograms/kg) subcutaneously and allowed to eat freely; 2) given a placebo and fed the same quantity of food as the group receiving estradiol; 3) given a placebo with no restrictions on eating. The affinity of insulin for liver and hypothalamus tissues was assessed using a detailed film autoradiography technique. Rats treated with estradiol experienced weight loss (p < 0.001) and showed higher levels of insulin in their blood (p < 0.01). The connection of insulin to liver cells was stronger in the estradiol group compared to the untreated group, but weaker than in the control rats fed the same amount of food as the estradiol group (p < 0.05), indicating that estradiol reduced the liver's insulin binding when food consumption was the same. However, insulin's attachment to specific areas of the hypothalamus, including the dorsomedial, ventromedial, and arcuate nuclei, remained unaffected by changes in diet or estradiol treatment. This suggests that changes in insulin or estradiol's influence on eating behavior are unlikely to be due to changes in insulin binding within these hypothalamic regions.", "named_entities": ["ovariectomized rats", "estradiol benzoate", "subcutaneously", "plasma insulin", "liver insulin binding", "dorsomedial", "ventromedial", "arcuate nuclei", "hypothalamus"]}

original: original_corpus: 'There is association between migraine, particularly migraine with aura, and large persistent foramen ovale (PFO) and other right-to-left shunts. Migraine is often improved by closure of a PFO in patients who have a large shunt. Inheritance of migraine is linked to the inheritance of large atrial shunts in some families. The data indicate that in some patients PFOs play a causal role in migraine with aura. These observations may also improve understanding of the etiology of migraine in patients who do not have a shunt.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "There exists a link between migraine, especially migraine accompanied by aura, and the presence of a large persistent foramen ovale (PFO) and other right-to-left shunts. Patients with a significant shunt often experience an improvement in migraine symptoms following the surgical closure of a PFO. The tendency to experience migraines is seen to be hereditary, particularly in families where large atrial shunts are common. The evidence suggests that PFOs may be a contributing factor to the occurrence of migraine with aura in some individuals. Furthermore, these findings could also enhance the understanding of migraine causes in patients who do not possess a shunt.", "named_entities": ["migraine", "aura", "persistent foramen ovale (PFO)", "right-to-left shunts", "atrial shunts"]}

original: original_corpus: 'The levels of 11 essential minerals in food commodity groups and total diets of adult males, infants, and toddlers were summarized from the Selected Minerals in Foods Survey, Fiscal Years (FY) 1974 through mid-1982, of the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) to evaluate the sources and adequacy of those minerals in the diets. The three diets were adequate in calcium, phosphorus, magnesium, potassium, manganese, and selenium; low in copper; and elevated in sodium and iodine. Iron was adequate in adult male but not in infant or toddler diets, and zinc was adequate in infant but somewhat low in adult male and toddler diets. Dairy products; meat, fish, and poultry; grain and cereal products; and fruits and vegetables were the major sources of the 11 minerals. Some statistically significant differences in mineral levels were found among years for total diets and food commodity groups. Regression analysis indicated several linear trends in the mineral content of food commodity groups but no linear trends in the mineral levels of total diets. FDA continues to monitor the levels of minerals in food and diets through the revised Total Diet Study program, which began in mid-FY82.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "A summary of the essential mineral levels in various food groups and the complete diets of adult men, infants, and toddlers was derived from the Selected Minerals in Foods Survey conducted by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) from Fiscal Years 1974 to mid-1982. This analysis aimed to assess the mineral sources and their sufficiency in the diets. The results showed that the diets generally provided adequate amounts of calcium, phosphorus, magnesium, potassium, manganese, and selenium; however, levels of copper were found to be low, while sodium and iodine levels were higher than desired. Iron levels were sufficient for adult men but insufficient for infants and toddlers, and zinc levels were adequate for infants but slightly low for adult men and toddlers. The primary sources of these 11 essential minerals were identified as dairy products, meats (including fish and poultry), grains and cereals, and fruits and vegetables. Notably, statistical analysis revealed significant variations in mineral content across different years for both total diets and specific food groups. original: original_corpus: 'The influence of general anaesthesia for operations devoid of substantial tissue traumas on the postoperative pattern of hepatic enzymes was studied in 40 patients undergoing ophthalmologic surgery. 20 had neurolept analgesia, 20 had halothane anaesthesia. The duration of anaesthesia, age of the patients and their previous history corresponded fairly closely to those of a group of patients who had gynaecological operations and were the subject of a previous study. In contrast to the latter group total protein, cholinesterase, GOT, GPT, LDH, GLDH, AP, LAP and gamma-GT remained normal up to 12 days after the operation. The exception were changes in the total bilirubin levels which were similar to those observed in the gynaecological cases. Possible causes are discussed.'

original: original_corpus: 'The delta-globin genes of a normal Japanese and a Japanese patient with homozygous delta-thalassemia were cloned, and the nucleotide sequence of a region including the gene was determined. Comparison of the nucleotide sequences of these two individuals with that of pH delta 1, delta-globin clone from the gene library constructed by Maniatis et al., showed differences in the large intervening sequence (IVS 2), at positions 137, 151, 186, 188, 291, 292 and 540 as one base substitutions, at 339 and 823 as one base additions, at 548 as a one base deletion, and a 9 bp duplication between positions 651 and 659, and differences in the 3'-flanking sequence at 51 and 98 nucleotides 3' to the AATAAA sequence. However, in the region studied, no differences was observed in the nucleotide sequences of the normal subject and the patient with delta-thalassemia. Therefore, these differences may represent polymorphisms of the delta-globin gene present in Japanese individuals. These data suggest that IVS 2 is more divergent than other regions, and that a DNA region(s) other than the globin gene may affect expression of the gene.'

original: original_corpus: 'New low-energy electron injection systems based on indirectly heated dispenser cathodes facilitate electron capture dissociation (ECD) in Fourier transform ion cyclotron resonance (FTICR) mass spectrometry. In this joint report, details are presented of the design and performance of these systems on two commercial FTICR instruments, 9.4 T Bruker BioAPEX in Uppsala and 4.7 T IonSpec Ultima in Odense. New results include obtaining meaningful one-scan MS/MS data for isolated precursor ions with millisecond irradiation times. The ECD rate improvement is not only due to the larger total electron current, but the larger emitting area as well.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "Recent advancements in electron injection technology, utilizing indirectly heated dispenser cathodes, have enhanced electron capture dissociation (ECD) processes in Fourier transform ion cyclotron resonance (FTICR) mass spectrometry. A collaborative report provides insights into the design and effectiveness of these improved systems on two different FTICR devices, the 9.4 Tesla Bruker BioAPEX located in Uppsala and the 4.7 Tesla IonSpec Ultima found in Odense. A major achievement highlighted is the capability to acquire significant MS/MS data from isolated precursor ions with just milliseconds of irradiation. The increase in ECD efficiency stems not just from the heightened total electron flow but also from the expanded area of electron emission.", "named_entities": ["electron capture dissociation (ECD)", "Fourier transform ion cyclotron resonance (FTICR)", "mass spectrometry", "9.4 T Bruker BioAPEX", "4.7 T IonSpec Ultima", "MS/MS data", "indirectly heated dispenser cathodes"]}

original: original_corpus: 'Sixty-two cases of oligohydramnios diagnosed by ultrasound between 13-28 weeks' gestation were reviewed. Three experienced ultrasonographers used a subjective scale to rate the oligohydramnios as mild, moderate, severe, or anhydramniotic. Interobserver reliability was excellent (intraclass correlation coefficient 0.81). The overall perinatal mortality rate was 43%, and the incidence of pulmonary hypoplasia was 33%. One-third had lethal congenital anomalies. The frequency of adverse outcome correlated strongly with the most severe degrees of oligohydramnios; 88% of the fetuses with severe oligohydramnios or anhydramnios had lethal outcomes, compared with 11% in the mild/moderate group. The presence of an anuric urinary tract anomaly was associated with the most severe grades of oligohydramnios and was uniformly fatal. Pulmonary hypoplasia was diagnosed in 60% of the severe group versus 6% in the moderate group. We conclude that subjective grading of oligohydramnios by experienced observers is both reliable and predictive of outcome. The finding of severe oligohydramnios in the second trimester is highly predictive of poor fetal outcome and should stimulate a thorough search for etiology and consideration of intervention. Moderate grades of reduced amniotic fluid may be managed with relative optimism.'

original_corpus: 'Myrtaceae family (121 genera, 3800-5800 spp.) is one of the most important families in tropical forests. They are aromatic trees or shrubs, which frequently produce edible fruits. In the neotropics, ca. 1000 species were found. Several members of this family are used in folk medicine, mainly as an antidiarrheal, antimicrobial, antioxidant, cleanser, antirheumatic, and anti-inflammatory agent and to decrease the blood cholesterol. In addition, some fruits are eaten fresh or used to make juices, liqueurs, and sweets very much appreciated by people. The flavor composition of some fruits belonging to the Myrtaceae family has been extensively studied due to their pleasant and intense aromas. Most of the essential oils of neotropical Myrtaceae analyzed so far are characterized by predominance of sesquiterpenes, some with important biological properties. In the present work, chemical and pharmacological studies carried out on neotropical Myrtaceae species are reviewed, based on original articles published since 1980. The uses in folk medicine and chemotaxonomic importance of secondary metabolites are also briefly discussed.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "The Myrtaceae family, consisting of 121 genera and between 3800 to 5800 species, stands as a cornerstone within tropical forests. Characterized by their aromatic nature, these trees or shrubs often yield edible fruits. Approximately 1000 species have been identified in the neotropics alone. Many Myrtaceae species are traditionally employed in herbal medicine for their therapeutic effects, including treatments for diarrhea, microbial infections, oxidative stress, cleansing, rheumatic pain, inflammation, and lowering cholesterol levels. Furthermore, their fruits are popularly consumed fresh, or used in the production of juices, liqueurs, and confections, celebrated for their flavors. The distinct and appealing aromas of some Myrtaceae fruits have led to in-depth investigations into their flavor profiles. Essential oils derived from neotropical Myrtaceae, mostly noted for their sesquiterpene dominance, exhibit significant biological activities. This review synthesizes chemical and pharmacological research on neotropical Myrtaceae species, referencing studies published from 1980 onwards. It also touches on the relevance of their secondary metabolites in folk medicine and chemotaxonomy.", "named_entities": ["Myrtaceae family", "neotropics", "folk medicine", "sesquiterpenes", "chemotaxonomic importance", "secondary metabolites"]}

original: original_corpus: 'Heating at slowly rising temperatures is suspected to enhance thermotolerance in Listeria monocytogenes and, since anaerobic environments have been shown to facilitate resuscitation of heat-injured cells of this micro-organism, concern may arise about the possibility of L. monocytogenes surviving in minimally preserved products. The effect of rapid ( > 10 degrees C min-1) and slow (0.3 and 0.6 degrees C min-1) heating on survival of L. monocytogenes in sous vide cooked beef was therefore examined at mild processing temperatures of 56 degrees, 60 degrees and 64 degrees C. No statistically significant difference (P = 0.70) was observed between the tested heating regimes. Since the average pH of beef was low (5.6), and little or no effect was observed, a pH-dependency of heat shock-induced thermotolerance in L. monocytogenes is suggested to account for this result.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "It is believed that gradually increasing temperatures can improve heat resistance in Listeria monocytogenes. Furthermore, the presence of anaerobic conditions has been identified to help the recovery of this bacteria after being damaged by heat, raising concerns about its survival in lightly preserved food items. This study investigated the impact of fast (> 10 degrees C per minute) and slow (0.3 and 0.6 degrees C per minute) heating rates on the survivability of L. monocytogenes in beef prepared using the sous vide method, at moderate cooking temperatures of 56, 60, and 64 degrees C. The results showed no significant differences (P = 0.70) in survival rates between the different heating speeds. Given the low average pH of beef (5.6), and the minimal impact observed, the study suggests that the increased thermotolerance induced by heat shock in L. monocytogenes could be dependent on pH levels.", "named_entities": ["Listeria monocytogenes", "anaerobic environments", "heat-injured cells", "sous vide", "thermotolerance", "pH-dependency"]}

original: original_corpus: 'Providing efficient and effective aged care services is one of the greatest public policy concerns currently facing governments. Increasing the integration of care services has the potential to provide many benefits including increased access, promoting greater efficiency, and improving care outcomes. There is little research, however, investigating how integrated aged care can be successfully achieved. The PRISMA (Program of Research to Integrate Services for the Maintenance of Autonomy) project, from Quebec, Canada, is one of the most systematic and sustained bodies of research investigating the translation and outcomes of an integrated care policy into practice. The PRISMA research program has run since 1988, yet there has been no independent systematic review of this work to draw out the lessons learnt.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "Efficient and effective provision of services for the elderly is a major concern for government policies worldwide. Enhancing the cohesion of care services offers numerous advantages such as improved access, increased efficiency, and better outcomes for care. Despite the importance, there's a scarcity of studies on how to achieve successful integration of services for the aged. The PRISMA (Program of Research to Integrate Services for the Maintenance of Autonomy) initiative in Quebec, Canada, represents one of the most thorough and ongoing research efforts aimed at understanding how policies on integrated care can be implemented in practice. Having commenced in 1988, the PRISMA program is yet to be evaluated through an independent, systematic review to extract valuable insights.", "named_entities": ["PRISMA", "Quebec, Canada", "Program of Research to Integrate Services for the Maintenance of Autonomy"]}

original: original_corpus: 'Displaced retinal ganglion cells in birds are the sole source of the retinal projection onto the nucleus of the basal optic root, the main component of the accessory optic system. This nucleus has direct bilateral axonal projections onto the oculomotor nuclear complex, the trochlear nucleus- and folia IXc,d and paraflocculus of the vestibulocerebellum. The cerebellar projection terminates within a superficial band of the granule cell layer adjacent to the Purkinje cell layer as a mossy fiber system. This bisynaptic projection onto oculomotor neurons and the cerebellum may play a functionally distinct and specific role in oculomotor reflexes.'

This nucleus is connected to the oculomotor nuclear complex, the trochlear nucleus, and folia IXc,d and paraflocculus of the vestibulocerebellum through direct bilateral axonal projections. The projection to the cerebellum ends in a near-surface strip of the granule cell layer next to the Purkinje cell layer, forming a mossy fiber system. original: original_corpus: 'It is very important to extract all four coupling-of-modes (COM) parameters of the electrode cells for the simulation and optimal design of a low loss surface acoustic wave (SAW) filter. A new approach for fast and full extraction of the COM parameters for multielectrode-type grating is proposed. The field distribution of the wave under the periodic shorted grating is calculated by periodic Green's function method. The phase of the reflection is determined from the positions of the standing wave node. The transduction coefficient and its phase are determined by the charge distribution at low frequency. The COM parameters of the commonly used electrode width controlled (EWC) single phase unidirectional transducer (SPUDT) is computed. It shows that this is a simple and direct way to extract all the COM parameters for SPUDT and, accordingly, is a powerful tool for the optimization of the filter structure.'

This technique involves calculating the wave's field distribution under a periodically shorted grating using the periodic Green's function method. The reflection phase is ascertained based on the locations of the standing wave nodes. Both the transduction coefficient and its phase are derived from the low-frequency charge distribution. The COM parameters for the widely utilized electrode width controlled (EWC) single phase unidirectional transducer (SPUDT) are calculated. original: original_corpus: 'Nanoplastics (NPs), mainly originated from weathering of microplastics, are ubiquitous throughout the world. However, the environmentally released NPs are still under debate due to the lack of direct proof for the chemical identification of individual nanoparticles. Here, we show an observational evidence of release of heterogeneous NPs from recycled PVC powders (RPP) using a nondestructive analytical method, namely, correlative Raman imaging and scanning electron (RISE) microscopy. The technology achieves direct chemical identification of individual nanoparticles on RPP surface that are as small as 360 nm including nano-PVC and nano-CaCO3 in complexes with pigments. After washing and filtering through a 1 μm poly(ether sulfone) filter, we clearly distinguish nano-PVC from the other components in an air-dried filtrate. Furthermore, the automated 2D mapping of RISE enables the acquisition of the 2D chemical information on a selected area (e.g., 5 μm × 5 μm) and the display of the different components of nanoparticle aggregates without colloidal separation. Our findings give direct evidence and detailed insights in the potential release of nanoplastics from the recycled plastic products. The RISE method will help us intuitively understand the origin, occurrence, and fate of NPs in the environment.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "Nanoplastics (NPs), primarily derived from the breakdown of microplastics, are found everywhere around the globe. The presence of environmentally released NPs is still a topic of discussion because there is no direct evidence to chemically identify individual nanoparticles. In this study, we present observational proof of the emission of diverse NPs from recycled PVC powders (RPP) by utilizing a non-destructive analytical technique, specifically, correlative Raman imaging and scanning electron (RISE) microscopy. This method allows for the direct chemical identification of single nanoparticles present on the surface of RPP, including nano-PVC and nano-CaCO3, combined with pigments and measuring as small as 360 nm. After a washing process and passing through a 1 Âµm poly(ether sulfone) filter, nano-PVC could be clearly differentiated from other substances in an air-dried filtrate. Additionally, through the automated 2D mapping capability of RISE, we can gather two-dimensional chemical data of a specific region (e.g., 5 Âµm x 5 Âµm) and visualize the different components of nanoparticle clusters without needing colloidal separation. Our discoveries provide concrete evidence and in-depth understanding of the likely emission of nanoplastics from recycled plastic items. The RISE technique offers a direct, intuitive way to comprehend the origin, presence, and destiny of NPs in the natural world.", "named_entities": ["Nanoplastics", "microplastics", "recycled PVC powders", "RISE", "nano-PVC", "nano-CaCO3", "poly(ether sulfone)"]}

original: original_corpus: 'Digital health management is increasingly pivotal in the care of patients with diabetes. The aim of this review was to evaluate the clinical benefits of using smart insulin pens with connectivity for diabetes management. The search was performed using PubMed and PubMed Central on May 15, 2019, to identify publications investigating the use of insulin pens. Studies evaluating insulin pens with connectivity via Bluetooth/Near Field Communication, with an associated electronic device enabling connectivity, or with a memory function were included in the review. Nine studies were identified in the search. Overall, these studies lacked data on smart insulin pens with a connectivity function, with eight of the available studies investigating only pens with a memory function. The studies focused primarily on assessing patient preference, usability, and technical accuracy. The number of studies assessing clinical outcomes was small (n = 3). However, the majority of studies (n = 8) reported that patients preferred smart insulin pens because they increased confidence with regard to diabetes self-management. These results suggest a lack of published data regarding smart insulin pens with connectivity for the management of diabetes. However, the available published data on usability and patient preference suggest that the use of smart insulin pens holds promise for improving and simplifying diabetes self-management.'

Included in this review were studies on insulin pens that could connect via Bluetooth/Near Field Communication, those that could connect to electronic devices, or those featuring a memory function. Nine studies were discovered through the search. The majority of these lacked information on smart insulin pens equipped with connectivity capabilities, with eight studies exploring pens equipped only with memory functions. These investigations primarily examined patient preferences, ease of use, and technical precision. Only a few studies (n=3) looked into clinical outcomes. Nonetheless, most of the studies (n=8) found that patients showed a preference for smart insulin pens as they boosted confidence in managing diabetes independently. While there appears to be a scarcity of published research on the efficacy of smart insulin pens with connectivity in diabetes management, the existing studies on their usability and the positive reception by patients indicate that smart insulin pens may enhance and streamline the self-management of diabetes.",

original: original_corpus: 'Women aged 45-64 in 78 general practices in the city of Edinburgh were followed up for five to seven years and all cause mortality noted. Standardised mortality ratios were calculated for the individual practices. Postcodes were available for a 20% sample of these women and were used to retrieve relevant measures of social class and deprivation from the 1981 census for the smallest division, the enumeration district. Weighted averages gave socioeconomic variables at the level of the general practice. High positive correlations were found between standardised mortality ratios and the socioeconomic variables, with the highest being for percentage overcrowding. This study established that the relation between deprivation and excess mortality can be shown in general practices in one large city and gave a direct relation for women without reference to their husbands' occupations, thus obviating problems of assigning social class. The data also partially refute the "social drift" hypothesis as an explanation of the association between mortality and social class.'
output: {"paraphrase_corpus": "In a study conducted over five to seven years, women between the ages of 45 and 64 from 78 general practices in Edinburgh were monitored, and their mortality rates were recorded. Mortality ratios standardized for each practice were determined. For a subset of 20% of these women, postcodes were utilized to access detailed social status and poverty indicators from the 1981 census data for the smallest area unit, the enumeration district. These indicators were then averaged to reflect socioeconomic factors at the practice level. A strong positive relationship was identified between the mortality ratios and socioeconomic factors, with overcrowding percentages showing the strongest correlation. The findings demonstrated that the impact of economic hardship on increased mortality rates can be directly observed in general practices within a major city, specifically for women, independently of their spouses' occupations. This is significant as it bypasses the issues related to social class assignment. Additionally, the results offer partial counterarguments to the 'social drift' theory, which suggests social class and mortality rates are linked due to people with poorer health moving down the social scale.", "named_entities": ["Edinburgh", "standardised mortality ratios", "1981 census", "enumeration district", "social drift"]}

original: original_corpus: 'This study evaluated pulsed TDI variables including the isovolumic time interval and duration of the major wave in a population of large healthy dogs. Longitudinal myocardial motion at the septal mitral annulus was evaluated with pulsed TDI in 45 healthy adult dogs. Maximal myocardial velocities, isovolumic time intervals, and duration of the myocardial waves were measured. The correlation between time intervals and velocity variables was also investigated. The mean maximal systolic velocity was 6.92 Â± 1.78 cm/sec, the mean early diastolic velocity (Em) was 6.58 Â± 1.81 cm/sec, the mean late diastolic velocity (Am) was 5.10 Â± 2.00 cm/sec, the mean isovolumic contraction time (IVCT) was 53.61 Â± 95.13 msec, and the mean isovolumic relaxation time (IVRT) was 26.74 Â± 57.24 msec. The early diastolic mitral inflow velocity (E)/Em ratio was 10.94 Â± 3.27 while the Em/Am ratio was 1.40 Â± 0.40. There was a negative correlation between Am duration and Am amplitude, and a positive correlation between the IVRT and Em/Am ratio (p < 0.05). The normal LV parameter using pulsed TDI method could be used as the reference range for identifying myocardial dysfunction in dogs.'

The average maximal systolic velocity was found to be 6.92 Â± 1.78 cm/sec, with the mean early diastolic velocity (Em) at 6.58 Â± 1.81 cm/sec, and the mean late diastolic velocity (Am) at 5.10 Â± 2.00 cm/sec. The average isovolumic contraction time (IVCT) was 53.61 Â± 95.13 msec, and the average isovolumic relaxation time (IVRT) was 26.74 Â± 57.24 msec.
